ARTIFACTS/Moonband/index.content:
Merisdae’s headband, crafted with 5 pieces of moon rock along the top, one piece from each moon. Imbued with soul pieces of Wefa, Anwi, and Esela.

CHARACTERS/Esela/index.title: Esela Levenkagaelii
CHARACTERS/Esela/index.content:
About
A young adult, who ran away from her home in Kohoii to be with her partner Kulith. She initiated the migration of the people of Asilles up to Crescentmoon.
Physical Description
General Physical Condition

clumsy girlfail :’3c
curvy/chubby

Body Features
Facial Features

soft, downturned eyes
round nose

Identifying Characteristics
Physical quirks
Special abilities
Esela’s Seeker’s Soul allows her to teleport.
Esela has to be able to visualize clearly the destination in order to be able to teleport. She has to have been there before, not just seen in pictures or described to her. Breaking concentration on the location can result in a unsteady arrival, or sometimes being teleported to the wrong place entirely.
Initially, she can only teleport herself short distances. However, with the amplification of Merisdae, she is capable of transporting groups of people over long distances. The further the distance, the more dust is required, meaning it takes a lot of Esela’s energy.
Apparel & Accessories

flowy chiffon-y overdress over solid underdress
ballet flats with ribbons up the legs
flower crown
blueish crystal necklace

Mental Characteristics
Personal history

grew up in Kohoii her entire life
was next in line to be the head of the Levenkagaelii
her mother, Naediia, died in a conflict between Kohoii and Solei

this causes her grandmother, Reika to be very protective of Esela especially around outsiders.


felt overwhelmed by pressure put on her
spent her free time away from others at her secret spot, which she called her Maeniil
one day Kulith stumbled into the maeniil, on the run from solei

esela helps her hide from solei, but also hides her from reika since she’s very against outsiders
the two become very close (gorlfriends)

also literally witnessing the end of the world?

her main motivation is just to help people. she was going to be the leader of levenkagaelii, but ran away.
she feels guilty about leaving kohoii, wants to help people as much as she can to make up for the people she couldn’t help back in kohoii

CHARACTERS/Kulith/index.title: Kulith Deiranii
CHARACTERS/Kulith/index.content:
About
A young adult Selhae born in the village of Solei. Born with an abnormally high concentration of Dust, their magic is powerful, yet unpredictable and hard to control. The heightened concentration of dust in Kulith’s Soul also influenced their appearance, giving them a blue tint to their pale skin, and ice blue hair.
Physical Description
General Physical Condition
Body Features
Facial Features
Identifying Characteristics

pale, slightly blue tinted skin

Physical quirks
Special abilities
Resonator’s Soul
Kulith’s magic centers around the ability to manipulate sound waves. When controlled and intentional, these powers can be used in benevolent ways such as making music and creating sound barriers for protection. However, due to its powerful and unpredictable nature, it can often be harmful - manipulating enough energy to create powerful blasts and even cause earthquakes. Using their powers in this way drains a lot of energy out of Kulith.
Apparel & Accessories

Specialized Equipment
Mental Characteristics
Personal history
From a young age, it was clear that Kulith was different from her peers. Her magic was hard to control, especially as a child, and thus became an issue very early on. She would get overstimulated or frustrated easily, making it harder and harder for her to keep her magic controlled.
As a child, authorities in Solei pressured Kulith into using their magic in attacks on Kohoii during the Solei War. This unfortunately resulted in the death of Naediia, Esela’s mother. Kulith was never told about the casualties of these attacks, and both her and Esela don’t know that it was Kulith who killed Naediia. Reika, being an elder of Kohoii, was aware of this, which heavily contributed to her vehement disapproval of Kulith and Esela together.
Kulith worked to escape Solei, no longer wanting to be used as a weapon in such a malicious war. Finally, in 1220 they were able to escape, and came across Esela in the Maeniil. The two fell for each other instantly, and Esela hid Kulith in the Maeniil away from her grandmother’s judgmental eyes.

CHARACTERS/Merisdae/index.title: Merisdae
CHARACTERS/Merisdae/index.content:
A construct created from the Moonband, a celestial headband embedded with pieces of the five Asilles moons.
About
Merisdae is a construct created by Esela in order to preside over the people who had migrated to Kuraesmeris during the Kuraesmeris Migration.
Moon Forms

Merisdae also has the ability to split herself into 5 forms. Each of these forms are named after the Asilles moons. Each of these forms were created to watch over their respective moons.
Supermoon

Merisdae’s “truest” form. Merisdae was originally a construct of Anwi and Wefa, the Inna, that created Asilles, but something happened to where she was de-constructed and left in her object form, the moonband. When Esela found the moonband and constructed Merisdae again, she appeared different due to not having the same soul.
Physical Description
Body Features
Merisdae has a slender build, with a height of 5’4” or 164cm. They have long, straight, flowy deep purple hair with blunt bangs and long sidelocks.
Facial Features
They have pinkish-magenta eyes, with the Lunatine symbol in their pupils.
Special abilities
Catalyst’s Soul
One of their most impressive abilities is the power to split themselves into five distinct forms, each of which represents one of the Asilles moons. This ability allows Merisdae to be in multiple places at once and keep a watchful eye over all of the moons simultaneously.
When Merisdae splits into her five forms, each form retains its specific memories while also retaining memories from when they were merged. However, they do not have memories of the other forms while separated. Once they merge back into one form, Merisdae has all of the memories of the five forms combined.
Furthermore, Merisdae is gifted with the ability to summon five small “moons” from the Moonband. These moons can be used in a variety of ways, from enhancing their physical strength to providing a source of light in a dark environment.
In addition to these powers, Merisdae also possesses the ability to manipulate gravity.
Apparel & Accessories
Merisdae wears a long, purple dress with a slit up the left side. The bottom of the dress is lined with the pattern shown on the right. The dress comes up to a sweetheart neckline, with a gold border across the top. In the center of the bust, connected to this border, is a small, pink diamond shape with a gold border around this as well. On her shoulders are sheer, light blue chiffon off-the-shoulder sleeves. The same material is used around her waist as well, where a long sash/belt is tied around her waist - one knot tied on either side of her hips. Each knot comes with a ribbon coming off of the belt, floating down to almost the same length as her dress. These ribbon tails become thinner at the end, almost becoming transparent. On her right leg, a blue ribbon is tied up to just below her knee, similar to a ballet shoe’s ribbon. Due to her ability to float, she does not wear shoes.

Specialized Equipment
On her head, Merisdae can be seen wearing the Moonband, a golden headband with five moon stones embedded into it. This item is what Merisdae was constructed from. Merisdae is able to summon forth 5 small moons from the moonband. When she does his, the moonband is not seen atop her head.

Mental Characteristics
Personal history
Merisdae was created by the Inna, Anwi and Wefato be a guardian of Asilles and to choose a Selhae to guide the people up to the moons in the Kuraesmeris Migration. She chose Esela to be this guide, linking the two’s souls together.
She saved Kaeyomii’s soul from the Debris Impact by taking Kaeyomii’s soul into her own, which influenced the appearance of her KaeMerisdae form. However, saving Kaeyomii led to the deconstruction of Merisdae back down to the moonband.
Due to the link between her and Esela, Esela was able to find the moonband and reconstruct Merisdae. She does not have any recollection of her previous incarnation, but she does remember the goal given to her by the Inna - save the people of Asilles.
Accomplishments & Achievements
Failures & Embarrassments
Mental Trauma
she got that masking trauma
feels like she has to be a different person in front of everyone to be what they want/need (or what she thinks they want/need) instead of being who she is

CONCEPTS/Asilles-Calendar.title: Asilles Calendar
CONCEPTS/Asilles-Calendar.content:
Asilles Calendar
Asilles uses a standardized 13 month calendar, each month with 30 days. This adds up to a total of 390 days in a year. Each month has three weeks of 10 days each.
The first nine weekdays are named after the elements, and the last weekday is named after the Inna. The weekdays are as follows:

Hiitothe (lit. “water day”)
Dothe (lit. “fire day”)
Muthuthe (lit. “electricity day”, “lightning day”)
Samthe (lit. “wind day”)
Athe (lit. “ground day”, “earth day”)
Yomiithe (lit. “life day”)
Aemthe (lit. “darkness day”)
Daethe (lit. “light day”)
Pakamthe (lit. “dust day”)
Iinyathe (lit. “Inna day”)

The calendar starts at year 1, the year that Anwi and Wefa created the Selhae and the Fae. Asilles had been around for thousands of years at this point, and referring to a date before year 1 is done with negative numbers. (i.e. 1/1/-200)
When the calendar was first created, the Selhae and the Fae were still intertwined in one society, speaking Varae. Therefore, even though the fae are now isolated from the Selhae, and speak mainly Acorithe, the fae still use the same calendar as the Selhae, including the Varae names.
Asilles Calendar (Months)
Asilles Calendar (Days)

CONCEPTS/Construction.title: Construction
CONCEPTS/Construction.content:
Construction
tags: magic
The act of creating a living being, by imbuing an inanimate object (Essence) with a soulpiece from the creator’s Soul. The soulpiece and magic are then pulled out of the object, resulting in a living being that can take on almost any form the creator wishes, including humanoid, animal, and mythical creature forms.

Construction is a sub-type of Creation magic, which focuses more on imparting a soul into an object than creating the soul itself.
Construction requires more of a “ritual” than Creation as well, as the object being turned into a construct must be crafted. For example:
Merisdae - Construct of Moon. a piece from each of the Asilles moons were collected and crafted into the Moonband, and imbued with a soulpiece.
Canelé - Construct of Stardust. Stardust was collected and crafted into a Stardust Gem, then imbued with a soulpiece.
Osuhii - Construct of Riverstone. Stones from the Kohoii River were collected and polished into beads, then made into a bracelet. The bracelet was imbued with a soulpiece.
It is not a separate process for the soulpiece to be added, but rather, through the act of crafting these objects, they intrinsically retain a piece of the creator’s soul. “i put my heart and soul into it” but real. It does have to be intentional though, no accidental constructs.
If the crafted object is damaged or destroyed, the soulpiece is released and attempts to return to its original soul. If merely damaged, the object may be repaired with intent and the construct can be re-constructed.
In the case of Merisdae, the moonband was damaged in the Debris Impact, but Esela repaired the headband with pieces from the new moon and re-constructed Merisdae. Because the soulpiece is different from Merisdae’s original Inna soulpiece, she comes back in a different, simpler form.

CONCEPTS/Construction/index.title: index
CONCEPTS/Construction/index.content:
The act of creating a living being, by imbuing an inanimate object (Essence) with a soulpiece from the creator’s Soul. The soulpiece and magic are then pulled out of the object, resulting in a living being that can take on almost any form the creator wishes, including humanoid, animal, and mythical creature forms.

Construction is a sub-type of Creation magic, which focuses more on imparting a soul into an object than creating the soul itself.
Construction requires more of a “ritual” than Creation as well, as the object being turned into a construct must be crafted. For example:
Merisdae - Construct of Moon. a piece from each of the Asilles moons were collected and crafted into the Moonband, and imbued with a soulpiece.
Canelé - Construct of Stardust. Stardust was collected and crafted into a Stardust Gem, then imbued with a soulpiece.
Osuhii - Construct of Riverstone. Stones from the Kohoii River were collected and polished into beads, then made into a bracelet. The bracelet was imbued with a soulpiece.
It is not a separate process for the soulpiece to be added, but rather, through the act of crafting these objects, they intrinsically retain a piece of the creator’s soul. “i put my heart and soul into it” but real. It does have to be intentional though, no accidental constructs.
If the crafted object is damaged or destroyed, the soulpiece is released and attempts to return to its original soul. If merely damaged, the object may be repaired with intent and the construct can be re-constructed.
In the case of Merisdae, the moonband was damaged in the Debris Impact, but Esela repaired the headband with pieces from the new moon and re-constructed Merisdae. Because the soulpiece is different from Merisdae’s original Inna soulpiece, she comes back in a different, simpler form.

CONCEPTS/Creation.title: Creation
CONCEPTS/Creation.content:
Creation
tags: magic
The act of creating a Soul or Essence out of concentrated Dust. This is an ability that is unique to the Inna.
Selhae can use the power of Construction, which is related to creation in that the user takes a soulpiece from their own soul and combines it with essence to make a Construct, however these are not complete souls being created and thus is a construction rather than a creation.

CONCEPTS/Domains.title: Domains
CONCEPTS/Domains.content:
Domains
all domains are defined as kingdoms or independent settlements.

kingdoms are domains comprised of multiple villages, towns, or cities. they are usually monarchal, with one leader such as a queen, prince, etc.

i.e. kingdom of Acorithe ruled by Colarius, prince


independent settlements are small villages or towns that grew from the settlement of a clan of Selhae. they are usually run by the clan that founded it, as a council. the elder of the clan is usually the head of the council.

i.e. village of Kohoii, ruled by Reika, kohoii clan elder.



all domains are different in their ambitions, but some are more imperial than others and wish to conquer smaller settlements to expand their reach.

this situation is what started the Solei War, as the kingdom of Solei attempted to annex the neighboring settlement of Kohoii.

education across domains

settlements will often have small schoolhouses for children, but more likely than not will not have any kind of upper/continued education for adults.
larger kingdoms will likely have upper education in larger cities such as the capitol, as well as schoolhouses for children in smaller towns and villages.
curriculum varies depending on the domain, as domains have differing ideals that they want to impart on their children.

i.e. a kingdom may focus on academia or military education, whereas an independent settlement may focus on agriculture or other trades.
fae-majority domain schools will often have a heavy focus on Elemental Magic

independent settlements are small villages or towns that grew from the settlement of a clan of Selhae. they are usually run by the clan that founded it, as a council. the elder of the clan is usually the head of the council.

CONCEPTS/Dust.title: Dust
CONCEPTS/Dust.content:
Dust
tags: magic
At the beginning of the universe, The Expanse was empty. Dust came to be, alongside the first Inna, Hafei, to fill the void. From dust comes Essence and Souls. These two, along with dust in its pure form, make up the universe. Dust also sparks the powers of Creation and Construction.

Types of Dust
Pure Dust
Pure Dust is dormant dust, not being used for any sort of creation or magic. It lays inert in the universe, until a being uses it for Creation . This is dust in its default state.
When dust is active and part of a being, it will always become either essence or soul. Beings cannot absorb or hold onto pure dust in its inert form.

Essence
Essence creates things with physical forms, but without magic or souls. It is created from pure dust.
Souls
Souls give life and sentience using magic. It is created from pure dust, highly compressed. These souls will attach themselves to dust (either in pure form or in the form of essence) and will create a living being.


Dust within Beings
To be considered “alive”, a being must possess enough Soul to hold themselves together, and support their life. Some beings also have essence to give themselves a physical form, but this is not necessary.
Essence and soul do not mix, so generally the way this appears is with a smaller, compressed Soul core within an outer Essence shell.


Inna are beings made purely of Soul dust. They contain no Essence, and thus do not have a physical form.

Selhae and Fae follow the most common structure of being. This is a soul, surrounded by essence that provides a physical form and appearance to the being.

Constructs are similar to the Selhae and Fae, except their soul is incomplete. The soul dust within them, on its own, is not enough to facilitate life. So, it is supplemented with Essence. This is unique to constructs, and cannot be done to normal Selhae or Fae souls.


a diagram showing the dust makeup of different beings. purple - soul, blue - essence
Stability
All forms of dust essentially want to return back to this default, inert state, as it is the most stable. Over time, beings will slowly “lose” their soul dust or essence (known as “waning”), as it returns to its stable form as pure dust.
In terms of stability, pure dust is the most stable, then essence, then soul. So, since souls are the most unstable state for dust to be in, the soul will wane/lose dust before essence will.
Other than gradually waning over time, using magic will also cause soul to wane.
When the soul wanes completely, the being owning this soul dies. It has no soul, and is purely essence. Then, as there is no soul to hold the essence together, the essence begins to wane as well. When a being’s essence has completely waned, the being essentially disappears. It has no essence, or soul, and no longer Exists.
Strength & Magic
In general, the more dust a being has, the stronger it is. This could mean a lot of things - the being may be able to hold itself together better, and would wane slower. Its magic and abilities would also be stronger.

CONCEPTS/Elemental-Magic.title: Elemental Magic
CONCEPTS/Elemental-Magic.content:
Elemental Magic
tags: magic
magic used by the Fae that centers around the elements. this type of magic is solely used on manipulating the dust of elements in the outside world, and cannot be used to manipulate dust within a person or their soul.
elements
as fae Souls work outwards towards the Dust  in the world, their elements follow a hierarchy - starting at fire, and working out to arcane/dust, the higher tiers are more in tune with the dust in the environment.


water/ice
adaptability, flow, and preservation



fire/heat
passion, destruction, and transformation



electricity
energy, speed, and precision



air/wind
freedom, communication, and the unseen



earth/ground
stability, endurance, and foundation



nature/life
growth, vitality, and connection



dark
mystery, fear, and concealment



light
clarity, revelation, and guidance



arcane/dust
transcendence, omnipresence, and creation

elemental resonance
a fae is born with a resonance to a certain element. this resonance determine s what element they are capable of manipulating. in the tiers higher than tier one, all tiers beneath it are inherited as well  - meaning someone with a nature resonance would also be able to manipulate water, fire, and electricity on top of being able to manipulate nature.

a tier one resonance (to water, fire, or electricity) is the most common. being the core elements, all fae are able to manipulate at least one of these, if not all three (tier 2+)
a tier two resonance (to air, earth, or nature) is the second most common - but still not very rare whatsoever. it inherits tier one elements.
a tier three resonance (to dark or light) is uncommon, but not rare. it inherits tier two and tier one elements.
a tier four resonance is very rare. the only element in this tier is arcane. fae with arcane resonance are resonant to all types of dust in their environment, and can manipulate it.

CONCEPTS/Inna-Tenets.title: Inna Tenets
CONCEPTS/Inna-Tenets.content:
Inna Tenets


The Inna Tenets

Neglect not the garden you have sown.

Care for your creations.


World seeds must not be neglected or treated badly. It can result in a weak, hurt Inna, which is cruel to the Inna and to the Expanse.


Creation leads to Endings, and Endings lead to Beginnings.

The cycle of created life must be respected.


All dust taken from the expanse must return to the expanse. Dust contributed to a world seed must return to the Inna that blooms from it.


Honor the connections between Inna.

All threads are connected.


Conflict between Inna is meaningless. All Inna work toward the same goal, and all Inna are connected through Dust.

CONCEPTS/Soul.title: Soul
CONCEPTS/Soul.content:
Soul
tags: magic
The heart of a living being, made of concentrated Dust. They can be created with the power of Creation, or through reproduction in a species with Souls.
Selhae and Fae are all born with souls, and Constructs have an artificial soul made from a piece of their creators soul and Essence in an inanimate object.
Inna souls are created in the form of a World Seed.

Makeup / Complete vs Incomplete Souls
The makeup of a being’s soul can be thought of in layers. Generally, the way this appears is with a smaller, compressed Soul core within an outer Essence shell.


Inna are beings made purely of Soul dust. They contain no Essence, and thus do not have a physical form.

Selhae and Fae follow the most common structure of being. This is a soul, surrounded by essence that provides a physical form and appearance to the being.

Constructs are similar to the Selhae and Fae, except their soul is incomplete. The soul dust within them, on its own, is not enough to facilitate life. So, it is supplemented with Essence. This is unique to constructs, and cannot be done to normal Selhae or Fae souls.


a diagram showing the dust makeup of different beings. purple - soul, blue - essence

Inna only have a soul and no physical appearance.
Selhae/Fae have a complete soul and a physical appearance
Constructs have an incomplete soul but still have a physical appearance

The definition of an “incomplete” soul is not exact. It is more defined by how it affects the being the soul belongs to. The less dust a being has, the harder it becomes for the being to hold its form and retain said dust.

[idk about this explanation actually] For example - if you were to measure dust in its weight, and the average Selhae/Fae has 100g of soul dust:

A being with 100g of soul dust - The soul is strong enough to hold the essence/shell layer together, and keeps the being alive.

This would be a complete Selhae or Fae.


A being with 25g of soul dust wouldn’t be strong enough to survive on its own. The essence/shell layer would not be able to be held together, and the being would begin to fade.

Its soul could be rounded out with 75g of essence dust to essentially supplement the low amount of soul dust. This is Construction, taking a small piece of soul and supplementing it with essence to create a stable being.
This being would be a Construct


A being with 75g of soul dust is strong enough on its own, and doesn’t need essence to supplement it. this is a selhae who has created a construct or maybe a multitude of small constructs. its soul is still considered “complete”, since it can support itself without essence supplement

if this being kept making constructs and taking more of its soul to do so, it would put itself at risk of becoming an “incomplete” soul itself.
this would be bad because a selhae cannot regenerate soul, but also cannot turn themselves into constructs by rounding themselves out with essence
if the selhae were to become incomplete in this way, they would begin losing their dust (essentially dying) due to not being able to hold themselves together anymore. no strength left
this has not often happened, as it is easily preventable via “stop making fucking constructs or you’ll literally die” fjkdsfjsdkfdjskf






Archetypes
Each soul resonates with an “archetype”, determining their natural “gifts” or “abilities”. These gifts are magic in nature, providing the user abilities one would not have without the same archetype. These come from resonating with specific types and amounts of Dust in ones soul. The more Dust you resonate with, the more powerful these abilities become.

There is a sort of hierarchy (not social, but metaphorical) of the archetypes, since some are more “powerful” than others. It can be visualized as a circle, the further inward you get (closer to the core of your soul) the more powerful your magic is, both within your ring and within the whole circle.
Shell Archetypes / Outer Soul Archetypes
The outermost layer, like a shell, interacts with the tangible world, offering protection, structure, and practicality. There are many types of Shell Archetypes, and it is the most common archetype as well.
Veil Archetypes / Middle Soul Archetypes
The middle layer acts as a veil or bridge between the surface and the core, with abilities focused on connection, discovery, and interaction. Veil Archetypes are slightly less common than Shell Archetypes, but are not unheard of in regular individuals.
Core Archetypes / Inner Soul Archetypes
The deepest, most essential layer of the soul, representing intrinsic truth, insight, and power. Core Archetypes can be very powerful, and there have only been a handful of Essence Archetypes discovered. It is rare to have these archetypes, as it means one has a very strong resonance with the core of their soul.
A list of known archetypes is as follows:
Outer Soul Archetypes (Shell)

Architect’s Soul

Theme: Building, Creation of inanimate things
Abilities: Creating tools, buildings, bridges, etc.


Shaper’s Soul

Theme: Transformation and refinement.
Abilities: Altering forms, improving objects, or refining raw materials into perfected states.


Scribe’s Soul

Theme: Knowledge and memory.
Abilities: Recording events, preserving information, or recalling precise details.


Guardian’s Soul

Theme: Protection and defense.
Abilities: Creating shields, reinforcing structures, or intercepting harmful forces.
Notable Characters: Naediia


Harvester’s Soul

Theme: Collection and absorption.
Abilities: Drawing energy from surroundings, gathering resources, or storing power.


Crafter’s Soul

Theme: Practicality and ingenuity.
Abilities: Repairing broken objects, crafting functional tools, or improving pre-existing designs.


Forager’s Soul

Theme: Survival and resourcefulness.
Abilities: Locating natural resources, identifying useful materials, or harvesting safely.


Tinker’s Soul

Theme: Mechanization and precision.
Abilities: Constructing intricate mechanisms, fine-tuning devices, or creating small automated constructs.


Planter’s Soul

Theme: Cultivation and growth.
Abilities: Encouraging plants to grow, restoring damaged ecosystems, or creating gardens.


Tidecaller’s Soul

Theme: Flow and motion.
Abilities: Manipulating liquids, creating currents, or ensuring smooth transitions.
Notable Characters: Canelé



Middle Soul Archetypes (Veil)

Healer’s Soul

Theme: Restoration and preservation.
Abilities: Healing physical wounds, mending objects, or restoring emotional balance.


Seeker’s Soul

Theme: Discovery and exploration.
Abilities: Sensing hidden truths, tracking, navigating, teleportation.
Notable Characters: Esela, Reika


Warden’s Soul

Theme: Restraint and containment.
Abilities: Binding forces, imprisoning energy, or restricting movement.
Notable Characters : BuroMerisdae


Shadow’s Soul

Theme: Subtlety and concealment.
Abilities: Hiding, cloaking objects, or moving unseen.
Notable Characters: FolMerisdae


Muse’s Soul

Theme: Inspiration and creativity.
Abilities: Sparking innovation, influencing emotions, or enhancing artistic expression.
Notable Characters: HiitoMerisdae



Inner Soul Archetypes (Core)

Seer’s Soul

Theme: Insight and foresight.
Abilities: Seeing into the past, glimpsing potential futures, or sensing the flow of fate.
Notable Characters: Kaeyomii, KaeMerisdae


Catalyst’s Soul

Theme: Amplification and acceleration.
Abilities: Enhancing existing forces, speeding up reactions, or magnifying the power of others.
Notable Characters: KuraesMerisdae


Resonator’s Soul

Theme: Resonance and equilibrium.
Abilities: Harmonizing the unseen forces of the world, wielding sound and vibrations to create balance or upheaval.
Notable Characters: Kulith




Selhae Souls
Selhae souls work inwards, towards the core of the self.
Selhae souls do not regenerate dust, and thus have a finite amount of dust before the user’s power wanes. When a Selhae’s soul gets too low on dust, they become unable to use their powers - this is to prevent them from using the last of their dust, as this will result in the Selhae’s death.
Archetypes don’t have too much of an impact on Selhae society - it’s encouraged to follow a profession that matches what you wish to do rather than your soul archetype, as these do not always align. One may have an architect’s soul, but prefer the arts to building. They can choose to find a way to use their powers in their profession if they’d like, but it is not necessary. for example, an artist with an architect’s soul could use their abilities to create a gallery for their artwork. or, they can create fine paintbrushes to use in their paintings.


It is not unheard of, however, for Selhae with Core Archetypes to be regarded highly. In the case of Kulith, for example, her highly in-tune Resonator’s soul is what captured the attention of Solei - leading to her kidnapping and use as a weapon.

Constructs
Within the soul is the magic of Construction. This magic is unique to Selhae, as you require both a complete soul (meaning Constructs cannot create other Constructs), and you must be able to access the power within your soul (meaning Fae cannot create constructs as their souls work outwards, rather than inwards).

Construction is defined as:
The act of creating a living being, by imbuing an inanimate object (Essence) with a soulpiece from the creator’s Soul. The soulpiece and magic are then pulled out of the object, resulting in a living being that can take on almost any form the creator wishes, including humanoid, animal, and mythical creature forms.


While Constructs are regarded by Selhae to have souls, their soul is not “complete” as they are in Selhae. Most constructs don’t have a complete soul but instead a soulpiece, which would follow the same archetype as their creator.


Merisdae is a sort of exception to this, due to her having more soul than most constructs. As Merisdae was constructed by the Inna, she causes an exception. She has a full soul with 5 archetypes, one for each of the moons. This is what causes her splits into multiple constructs. This also allows her to create constructs herself, such as Canelé.

Soulbonding
Constructs are more temporary beings, they’re inextricably linked to their creator due to the soul piece being the only soul they have. This link is called a Soulbond.
Generally, this results in the construct having the same soul archetype as their creator.
Additionally, since a constructs soul is partly essence from whatever object they were created from (moon, in merisdae’s case for example), it would also gain traits from whatever object it was (merisdae has some sort of gravity powers)

Fae Souls
Fae souls work outwards, towards the elements.
While fae souls do technically still resonate with an archetype, due to the direction their soul works in, fae do not receive any powers or abilities from its archetype.

Inna Souls


i guess technically it would make the creator’s soul a bit less complete, since a piece is taken out, but i think it also depends on how big the soul piece is compared to the creator’s soul

can they regenerate this now missing piece of soul?

depends on the being -

selhae cannot regenerate their soul, since they (as well as fae) do not have the power of Creation - they cannot turn pure dust into soul dust and thus cannot regenerate
inna however would theoretically be able to do this, since they do have the power of creation

this is what i want to limit when i talk about plus since inna can turn dust into soul dust anyway they can easily regenerate their own soul. tho i gotta work on that bc whats preventing any old inna from just taking a shitton of dormant dust just like sitting in the universe and making their soul hella strong? ive gotta make some sort of limitation to that but i don’t know how i would lmao

yes ( see the creator can also de-construct them at will as well )
the soul piece returns back to the creator

CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/Shell-Archetype.title: Shell Archetypes
CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/Shell-Archetype.content:
The outermost layer, like a shell, interacts with the tangible world, offering protection, structure, and practicality. There are many types of Shell Archetypes, and it is the most common archetype as well.
Outer Soul Archetypes (Shell)

Architect’s Soul

Theme: Building, Creation of inanimate things
Abilities: Creating tools, buildings, bridges, etc.


Shaper’s Soul

Theme: Transformation and refinement.
Abilities: Altering forms, improving objects, or refining raw materials into perfected states.


Scribe’s Soul

Theme: Knowledge and memory.
Abilities: Recording events, preserving information, or recalling precise details.


Guardian’s Soul

Theme: Protection and defense.
Abilities: Creating shields, reinforcing structures, or intercepting harmful forces.
Notable Characters: Naediia


Harvester’s Soul

Theme: Collection and absorption.
Abilities: Drawing energy from surroundings, gathering resources, or storing power.


Crafter’s Soul

Theme: Practicality and ingenuity.
Abilities: Repairing broken objects, crafting functional tools, or improving pre-existing designs.


Forager’s Soul

Theme: Survival and resourcefulness.
Abilities: Locating natural resources, identifying useful materials, or harvesting safely.


Tinker’s Soul

Theme: Mechanization and precision.
Abilities: Constructing intricate mechanisms, fine-tuning devices, or creating small automated constructs.


Planter’s Soul

Theme: Cultivation and growth.
Abilities: Encouraging plants to grow, restoring damaged ecosystems, or creating gardens.


Tidecaller’s Soul

Theme: Flow and motion.
Abilities: Manipulating liquids, creating currents, or ensuring smooth transitions.
Notable Characters: Canelé

CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/Veil-Archetypes.title: Veil Archetypes
CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/Veil-Archetypes.content:
The middle layer acts as a veil or bridge between the surface and the core, with abilities focused on connection, discovery, and interaction. Veil Archetypes are slightly less common than Shell Archetypes, but are not unheard of in regular individuals.
Middle Soul Archetypes (Veil)
Healer’s Soul

Theme: Restoration and preservation.
Abilities: Healing physical wounds, mending objects, or restoring emotional balance.

Seeker’s Soul

Theme: Discovery and exploration.
Abilities: Sensing hidden truths, tracking, navigating, teleportation.
Notable Characters: Esela, Reika

Warden’s Soul

Theme: Restraint and containment.
Abilities: Binding forces, imprisoning energy, or restricting movement.
Notable Characters : BuroMerisdae

Shadow’s Soul

Theme: Subtlety and concealment.
Abilities: Hiding, cloaking objects, or moving unseen.
Notable Characters: FolMerisdae

Muse’s Soul

Theme: Inspiration and creativity.
Abilities: Sparking innovation, influencing emotions, or enhancing artistic expression.
Notable Characters: HiitoMerisdae

CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/index.title: index
CONCEPTS/Soul/Archetypes/index.content:
Each soul resonates with an “archetype”, determining their natural “gifts” or “abilities”. These gifts are magic in nature, providing the user abilities one would not have without the same archetype. These come from resonating with specific types and amounts of Dust in ones soul. The more Dust you resonate with, the more powerful these abilities become.

There is a sort of hierarchy (not social, but metaphorical) of the archetypes, since some are more “powerful” than others. It can be visualized as a circle, the further inward you get (closer to the core of your soul) the more powerful your magic is, both within your ring and within the whole circle.

CONCEPTS/Soul/Soul-Makeup.title: Soul Makeup
CONCEPTS/Soul/Soul-Makeup.content:
The makeup of a being’s soul can be thought of in layers. Generally, the way this appears is with a smaller, compressed Soul core within an outer Essence shell.
Inna are beings made purely of Soul dust. They contain no Essence, and thus do not have a physical form.

Selhae and Fae follow the most common structure of being. This is a soul, surrounded by essence that provides a physical form and appearance to the being.

Constructs are similar to the Selhae and Fae, except their soul is incomplete. The soul dust within them, on its own, is not enough to facilitate life. So, it is supplemented with Essence. This is unique to constructs, and cannot be done to normal Selhae or Fae souls.

a diagram showing the dust makeup of different beings. purple - soul, blue - essence

Inna only have a soul and no physical appearance.
Selhae/Fae have a complete soul and a physical appearance
Constructs have an incomplete soul but still have a physical appearance

The definition of an “incomplete” soul is not exact. It is more defined by how it affects the being the soul belongs to. The less dust a being has, the harder it becomes for the being to hold its form and retain said dust.

CONCEPTS/Soul/index.title: index
CONCEPTS/Soul/index.content:
The heart of a living being, made of concentrated Dust. They can be created with the power of Creation, or through reproduction in a species with Souls.
Selhae and Fae are all born with souls, and Constructs have an artificial soul made from a piece of their creators soul and Essence in an inanimate object.
Inna souls are created in the form of a World Seed.

CONCEPTS/World-Seed.title: World Seed
CONCEPTS/World-Seed.content:
World Seed
A world seed is the first life stage of an Inna. It is created by another Inna using Dust and the power of Creation to create a Soul, as well as Essence to give it a physical form. These two components are then combined together using the power of Construction, leaving a world seed behind.
At it’s beginning, the seed is simply a small piece of the original Inna’s soul,  and doesn’t yet have enough soul to become an Inna with a complete soul. So, the Inna who created it (usually referred to as the “caretaker”) will tend to the planet as it grows. The caretakers will take dust from the universe and put it into/towards the seed indirectly by creating life and letting the planet flourish.
The world seed grows into a planet, leaving the seed at the core of the planet.
The world will go through its entire life cycle, and as it comes to its end, the dust in the Souls and the Essence of the planet begin to retreat back into the seed. Soul dust would be absorbed directly into the seed, but essence will return to its inert state as pure dust, and then is absorbed into the seed to be converted into soul dust as well.
After all dust has been absorbed, the seed will be a hyper compressed pocket of soul that will “burst” and bloom into a newborn Inna.
In the event the seed is not provided with enough dust and care, the seed will not bloom when the world ends. The dust in the seed’s soul will wane, and the core of the planet will fall apart, causing the rest of the planet to follow suit. The essence used in its creation will not be pulled in / held together by the seed any longer, and will return to its inert state of pure dust. This takes a long time, and it would just be a barren, dissolving planet as it dies.

According to the Inna Tenets, all dust that is taken from the universe to provide for a world seed must be allowed to be absorbed back into the world seed when its time comes. This is to keep the balance between Inna and the Expanse in check.
However, there have been a few cases of civilizations on these planets becoming advanced enough to leave their planet, before the world begins to wane. This causes trouble for the Inna, because the world seed will only absorb the dust from Souls and Essence that is currently on the planet.
Some Inna, to avoid persecution by the Seedkeeper Council, will influence their world’s cosmic explorers to return to the planet, to ensure their Dust returns to the seed before it blooms.
Others, if feeling bold enough, will attempt to allow their world’s space travelers to remain off-planet when the seed blooms, but this runs the risk of the traveler being caught or discovered by the Council, causing the caretaker to be punished severely.

EVENTS/Kohoii-Solei-War/Kohoii-Solei-War.title: Kohoii-Solei War
EVENTS/Kohoii-Solei-War/Kohoii-Solei-War.content:
Kohoii/Solei War
Created: June 23, 2023 12:12 PM
annual?: No

an ongoing war between the settlement of Kohoii and the kingdom of Solei, which began when Solei attempted to annex the neighboring settlement of Kohoii.
Solei, being a much larger force than Kohoii, began by occupying the settlement. Kohoii’s mages and warriors tried to fight them off for a while, but a devastating battle claimed many casualties (including Naediia, the elder’s daughter and head mage) and left the people of Kohoii with little choice but to accept the occupation, for now.

Solei used Kulith’s powerful abilities as a weapon in this battle.

EVENTS/timeline.title: timeline
EVENTS/timeline.content:
timeline
inna arc / The Story of the Inna / the LORE

in the beginning, there was nothing, and then there was The Expanse.

the expanse was vast, and empty, save for Dust
from dust came Hafei, the first of the Inna


to give meaning to the empty void, hafei created the World Garden

World Seeds are planted in the garden.

worlds/planets are grown from the seeds
at the natural end of the world, a newborn inna blossoms from the seed




together with the first few inna born in the garden, hafei forms the Seedkeeper Council to govern over the inna.

the council puts into place a set of tenets that all inna must follow - Inna Tenets
inna who don’t follow these tenets get punished, usually by having their dust confiscated by the Garden Wardens .

unbeknownst to them, this dust is actually being given to hafei to extend his life.


powerful inna that are close to hafei tend to hold the same beliefs as him, but many inna do not agree with his practices.

some inna do not believe all life on a planet should end with the bloom of an inna, and believe the inna and the people of its seed can exist at the same time
many believe that hafei should not be taking dust from other inna to extend his own life


hafei has been around long enough that he is much stronger than any inna that tries to dissent, but he cannot be everywhere at once. so, he enlists many inna to become the  the fieldtenders - spread out across the expanse to uphold each of the tenets for hafei.

Anwi and Wefa are World Curators, meaning they travel the expanse checking on worlds being grown to ensure they’re growing well and not being neglected.
Emeut is a [name pending], who travels the expanse to find any stray life that may have left a planet before the bloom of an inna, and ensure that inna are not intentionally disrupting the balance.

emeut is a relatively powerful inna, that has been around for a while (not as long as hafei but longer than many inna)
he has been harboring very extremist ideals, that inna should not be so concerned with the care of their seeds, and should be making as many inna as possible -regardless of how neglected they are - to fill the expanse.
while under the guise of working for the council, he has been using his dust to essentially “fund” other inna’s worlds for his own means. this has gained him many followers.






Anwi and Wefa check up on Emeut as part of their job and find that he has been neglecting many world seeds and creating essentially an army of inna to try to overthrow hafei.

emeut had convinced many other inna to help him create many world seeds that they ultimately would not put any care into, so they would bloom as soon as possible and become inna to work and fight for emeut when the time came for his coup.
emeut is punished severely by the Garden Wardens, and has most of his dust taken away.
other world curators are sent out to investigate and ensure whoever was working with emeut gets punished as well.
this only fuels emeut’s anger towards the council and hafei, but also towards anwi and wefa.


Anwi and Wefa plant their own world seed together.

anwi and wefa’s world seed sprouts into the planet Asilles.

4 moons sprouted around the planet as well - Kuraesmeris / crescentmoon, Hiitomeris / bluemoon, Buromeris / bloodmoon, and Folmeris / fullmoon.


as the planet grows, the pair decide to gift it sentient life as well. they each use their power of Creation to create beings to live on the planet, each with Souls that work in different ways.

anwi creates the Selhae

selhae souls work inwards, towards the core of the self. resonates with Soul dust.
received two gifts from anwi

Construction, which allows the selhae to create Constructs by imuing a physical object with a piece of their soul
Archetypes, which provide the selhae with unique powers and abilities determined by the type of resonance of their soul




wefa creates the Fae

fae souls work outwards, towards the elements. resonates with Essence dust.
received two gifts from wefa

Shapeshifting, which allows the fae to take on many forms
Elemental Magic, which provides fae with the ability to manipulate elements that resonate with their soul






at first, anwi and wefa play a very active role on asilles. the selhae and fae regard the inna as gods. however, as more inna are creating planets, anwi and wefa are needed more often to do their job for the seedkeepers.
as time passes, they get very attached to their creations and don’t want them to have to all die when the planet wanes and their new inna baby blooms, so they figure out a plan to save the life on the planet before it dies.

they construct two guardians to watch over the planet and assist when the time came

Merisdae  - will choose a selhae to guide the people to the moons
Yudora  - will choose a fae to establish life on the moons







asilles arc / the BACKSTORY

asilles begins to wane naturally, signaling the end of the planet’s lifespan. this happens slowly.

it isn’t really noticable by the people on asilles, but they might start noticing that the waning of dust from the planet is affecting their crops, etc.


Emeut finds out about anwi and wefa’s plan to save the people of asilles and decides to sabotage them because that is Wrong and disrupts the balance of the universe (and also because he wants revenge)

he decides he will take Atis, one of his follower’s long dead and neglected planets, and send it on a course directly into asilles, destroying the planet, the selhae and the fae, and the growing inna.
compared to asilles, atis is small - but large enough to do major damage to the planet. it is more comparable in size to an asteroid or a moon.



esela & kulith subplot

due to asilles’ dust waning, a panic in losing their crops and resources and needing to obtain more means of production kickstarts Solei to begin taking over more settlements (and in turn, kickstarts the Solei War)

as a young child, Kulith is used as a weapon in this war. notably, she is used in an attack on Kohoii, which kills Naediia


Esela grows up in Kohoii, being raised by her grandmother Reika
years after the attack on kohoii, kulith is able to escape solei and runs away.

she stumbles upon esela in the Maeniil and esela agrees to help hide kulith when solei inevitably comes looking for her

the two of them get super close and super gay for each other


reika finds the two of them together, and recognizes kulith as the girl who killed her daughter. reika sends kulith away and tells esela what she did

esela is super distraught and runs to the maeniil, only to find kulith waiting for her. the two of them talk and kulith explains that she was used against her will
esela forgives her, and they decide to run away from kohoii to be together




merisdae chooses esela as the selhae guide, linking merisdae and esela’s souls.
years pass, and esela and kulith settle down in Yuvomne and have Kaeyomii
kaeyomii begins seeing visions of Atis

kaeyomii tells esela and kulith about these visions, but as they are unaware of her rare archetype/powers at this time, they believe she is just an imaginative child
however, through esela, merisdae is made aware of atis and of kaeyomii’s ability to see into the future



colarius subplot


Colarius. also Urali. they exist

they’re doin their own thing over here but idk what yet lol



yudora chooses colarius as the fae representative, linking yudora and colarius’ souls.


anwi and wefa are summoned away from asilles to do their curator duties and leave merisdae and yudora in charge.

emeut uses this opening where anwi and wefa are both gone to throw atis



merisdae, in a panic, uses crescentmoon as a shield to protect the majority of the attack from hitting asilles


atis hits crescentmoon, knocking out a chunk of crescentmoon and also shattering atis. debris from both the moon and atis plummets down to asilles

crescentmoon is left with its crescent shape
the main piece that was knocked out of crescentmoon keeps its shape enough to fall back into orbit, and becomes Kaemeris / newmoon



merisdae decides that she needs help in order to attempt to save asilles from the impact of the debris - or at least perform damage control and make sure as little damage is done as possible

she knows, through her link with esela, that esela has teleportation abilities and kaeyomii can see the future.
she also knows yudora has [insert special barrier/blast powers here]
her plan is to recruit esela, kaeyomii and yudora and amplify their abilities.

kaeyomii, being able to see the debris impact happen ahead of time, would inform the group of the location of impact so they can focus their efforts.

amplified by merisdae - clearer visions


esela would teleport the group close to the impact site, and work to evacuate anyone in danger away from the site.

amplified by merisdae - further teleportation range


yudora would blast the debris away, hopefully either breaking the debris into smaller pieces, or, preferably, pushing the debris far enough away that it would no longer fall to asilles at all.

amplified by merisdae - stronger blast







merisdae enacts her plan.

the group is teleported right outside the blast radius, with kaeyomii’s navigational help
esela and kulith leave kaeyomii in what they believe to be a safe hiding spot outside of the range of the impact, and tell her not to leave no matter what until they come back.
esela and kulith work on evacuating anyone living in the danger zone
yudora and merisdae get prepared to blast the meteor away



emeut, already upset that his meteor missed, interferes further and speeds up the debris.

doing this is much riskier to him - throwing atis from afar would ensure he was not caught when anwi and wefa returned, but getting this close to the planet made it hard to dismiss the blame.
kaeyomii didn’t see this in any of her visions, so it was not accounted for.
panicking, yudora and merisdae get ready to blast the debris away, but…
the blast is not strong enough, and the debris simply resumes falling back to the planet… directly to where kaeyomii was hiding.



debris impacts with asilles.

with moments to spare, merisdae is able to reach kaeyomii at the impact site and, while she’s not able to save her physical form, merisdae absorbs kaeyomii’s soul into her own
merisdae and yudora are deconstructed by the force of the impact, leaving only the Moonband and Starlight Crystal? behind.
esela and kulith, now outside of the blast radius, survive the impact.



anwi and wefa return to asilles.

they catch emeut, who is at this point fading out of existence.
in his final words to anwi and wefa, emeut tells them of his suspicion that hafei is taking inna’s dust for himself, to make himself stronger and live forever



with esela’s link to merisdae, she knows that something went wrong and that she needs to go find kaeyomii

when they get back to the impact site, they’re unable to find even kaeyomii’s body in the rubble. the two are devastated at the loss of their child and to the destruction of the planet
however, esela finds the moonband and reconstructs merisdae with her own soulpiece


she returns in her “simpler” form, due to no longer having an inna’s soulpiece




kulith finds the starlight crystal and reconstructs yudora with her own soulpiece as well


also returns in a simpler form







anwi and wefa, now fully able to see what has happened to their planet, their world seed - see that the impact of the debris has accelerated the death of the planet

this means the dust on the planet will be increasingly absorbed into the seed, until nothing is left and the seed blooms into a new inna
merisdae and yudora see this as well, and know that it is time for them to perform the duties they were constructed to do, and migrate the population of asilles up to its moons.



arc 3 - the arcening

romanization<th>=/θ/, <y>=/j/, <i>=/ɪ/, <ii>=/i/, otherwise spelled as seen.allophones[s] & [z] = <s>, [ɛ] & [ɘ] = <e>, [r] & [ɹ] =<r>diphthongs/ɛi/ = <ae>, /ai/ = <ei>
phonotactics

syllable structure is (c)v(c).
onset can be any sound.
coda can be any sound but <y> or <w>.
<s> next to a voiced consonant often becomes /z/.
no <i> next to another vowel. if an <i> falls next to a vowel, a <y> will emerge between them.
repeated consonants/vowels, like <oo> ****or <dd> ****or <aeii> always drop the extra sound when part of the same word.
when a word with a coda consonant combines with a word lacking an onset consonant, the coda of the first always moves into the onset of the second.


sentence structure
word order
word order in varae is SOV (subject-object-verb).
adjectives are placed before their respective noun, and that extends to adjectival clauses and phrases. adpositions, however, are placed after the noun.
adverbs are placed after the verb, and that extends to adverbial clauses and phrases as well.
\num 1
\ex deii kuraesa meris fa vaesii
\gla deii kuraesa meris fa vae-sii
\glb 3SG beautiful moon at look-PRS
\glc SUBJECT (adj) OBJECT (adp) VERB
\ft She looks at the beautiful moon.
 
\num 2
\ex vaii siibte asu sokaso mosa
\gla vaii siibte asu soka-so mosa
\glb 1SG ground o fall-PAS down
\glc SUBJECT (adp) VERB
 
**"vaii siibte asu sokaso mosa"
vaii siibte asu soka-so  mosa**
1SG  ground to  fall-PAS down
SUBJECT OBJECT     VERB
"I fell down to the ground"
questions
question sentences are marked with the sem particle placed at the end of the sentence.
**"koii vaiivaii haeyase suran sem"
koii vaiivaii haeyase  suran sem**
2SG  1PL      join-FUT later Q
"Will you join us later?"
clauses
dependent clause
o is added as a prefix before certain pronouns and adverbs to turn them into relative pronouns and adverbs to be used in dependent clauses.


















































plain formrelative form“who”temotem“what”taeotae“where”tiilotiil“when”taota“why”tolotol“how”tamotam“that”taemotaem“which”tesotes
**"ota deii meris fa vaeso, deii eheso"
o-ta      deii meris fa vae-so,    deii ehe-so.**
REL-when  3SG  moon  at look-PST,  3SG  smile-PST.
"When she looked at the moon, she smiled."
**"iise otem nihoso vaii asu aeso vaeya"
iise   o-tem    niho-so    vaii asu ae-so  vaeya.**
person REL-who  speak-PST  1SG  to  be-PST kind.
"The person who spoke to me was kind."

words. vocab? idk what to call this section
nouns
pronouns
all pronouns are gender neutral. plural pronouns are made by reduplication.

























singularpluralfirst personvaii ”I”vaiivaii ”we/us”second personkoii ”you“koiikoii ”you all”third persondeii ”he/she/they/it”deiideii ”them all”
case system
this language only has one true case, that being the genitive case. the suffix fel is added to the end of the noun possessing the object.
**"selafel nuye"
sela-fel    nuye**
flower-GEN  petal
**"**The flower's petals"
**"niisafel saeka"
niisa-fel saeka**
fire-GEN  color
**"**The color of the fire"
a pseudo-case that varae also utilizes is in regards to the Inna - the god-like species that created the universe. when using pronouns in regards to them, the prefix iina is added. it acts as a sort of honorific, but is only utilized for the inna. generally, a person using this on themselves or another person would be thought of extremely negatively.

























singularpluralfirst personiinavaii ”I”iinavaiivaii ”we”second personiinakoii ”you“iinakoiikoii ”you all”third personiinadeii ”he/she/they/it”iinadeiideii ”them all”
plurality
varae generally does not express plurality. if the noun is countable, and the speaker wishes to specify how many of something there are, the speaker will generally just use numbers. in some cases, the noun can also be doubled to show there are many of something, but this is not always done.
adjectives
adjectives are always placed before the noun they are describing. for example, kumeiya leiv, “good dream”. a noun can also be used as an adjective by adding the affix ka to the end of the noun, for example, leiv, “dream”, becomes leivka, “dreamy”.
a note on adjectives in compound words (names only)
adjectives will always end in /a/, and when compound words are created (i.e. for names such as yudora meaning “little star”), the /a/ at the end is dropped. in the event of a /ya/ ending, such as in uya - “young”, the /y/ is dropped as well, resulting in, for example, kumeileiv, a compound noun/name with the same meaning as kumeiya leiv, meaning “good dream”. dosa (red) + sela (flower) becomes dosela, as stated in the phonotactics, double consonants are not allowed in the same word. the double /s/ is reduced to a single /s/. however, please note that these compound words are mainly only used for names, and in normal speech and prose “red flower” would still be dosa sela.
verbs
verbs in dictionary/plain form end in sii. these verbs are in present tense, for example vaesii - ”to see/look”. verbs are not conjugated depending on gender or plurality, only tense and aspect.
there are three tenses - present, past, and future. to conjugate tense, the sii ending is replaced with a new ending depending on the tense - so for past, and se for future.
there are three aspects as well - plain, perfect, and continuous. for aspect, a suffix is added to the end of the verb- me for perfect, ra for continuous.
to make a verb negative, the prefix mo is added to the beginning.
nouns can also be turned into verbs by adding this sii suffix, for example leiv, meaning “dream” turns into leivsii “to dream”. this also works inversely, removing the sii suffix will turn a verb into a noun.
regular verbs









































tense & aspectplain affirmativeplain negativeperfect affirmativeperfect negativecontinuous affirmativecontinuous negativepresentleivsii “dreams”moleivsii “doesn’t dream”leivsiime ”has dreamt”moleivsiime “hasn’t dreamt”leivsiira “is dreaming”moleivsiira “isn’t dreaming”pastleivso “dreamt”moleiso “didn’t dream”leivsome “had dreamt”moleivsome “hadn’t dreamt”leivsora “was dreaming”moleivsora “wasn’t dreaming”futureleivse “will dream”moleivse “won’t dream”leivseme “will have dreamt”moleivseme “won’t have dreamt”leivsera “will be dreaming”moleivsera “won’t be dreaming”
copula
the copula ae is the only irregular verb in varae, in the sense that it does not end in sii. present plain form is simply ae , and all affixes remain the same.
**"maerut ~ vaii somela aeme"
maerut ~  vaii somela ae-me.**
recently, 1SG  happy  be-PRS-PRF.
"Recently, I have been happy."
**"honthe vaii ralaniin asu moaese garusera"
honthe  vaii ralaniin asu mo-ae-se   garu-se-ra.**
tonight 1SG  festival to  NEG-be-FUT go-FUT-CONT.
****"I will not be going to the festival tonight."
moods
varae has three moods: the indicative, imperative, and the abilitative. they can be used by adding a mood-specific prefix before a verb. this prefix precedes any other prefix on the verb, such as the negation prefix mo.

























affirmativenegativeindicativeleivsii “dream”moleivsii “doesn’t dream”imperativekoleivsii “dream!”komoleivsii “don’t dream!”abilitativesoleivsii “can dream”somoleivsii “can’t dream”
**"vaii somoleivsii gobu sem"
vaii so-mo-leivsii   gobu sem**
1SG  ABL-NEG-dream   even Q
"Can't I even dream?"
adverbs
adverbs do not always follow a strict pattern. they are always placed after the verb they modify. adjectives can be turned into adverbs by changing the last syllable, containing the /a/ ending, to kel. for example, hata , an adjective meaning “eager”, turns into hakel, an adverb meaning “eagerly”.
numbers and counting























kii ( 0 )thae ( 1 )tei ****( 2 )iia ****( 3 )adi ****( 4 )uru ****( 5 )uiio ****( 6 )sus ( 7 )bii ( 8 )kuo ****( 9 )ran ****( 10 )siin ****( 100 )miin ****( 1k )wiin ****( 1mil )
numbers after ten below 20 are ran+(digit), for example ranuru. tens from 20 to 90 are (digit)+ran, as in teiran to kuoran. hundreds from 200 to 900 are (digit)+siin. thousands from 2000 to 9000 are (digit)+miin.
siin, miin, and wiin can be thaesiin, thaemiin, and thaewiin, but it is not common.
when written out, each digit place is considered a separate word.
**"uiiroran iia"
uiio-ran iia**
six-ten  three
"63" / "sixty three"
**"iiasiin iiaran kuo"
iia-siin       iia-ran    kuo**
three-hundred  three-ten  nine
"339" / "three hundred thirty nine"
**"biimiin siin adiran uru"
bii-miin        siin    adi-ran   uru**
eight-thousand  hundred four-ten  five
"8145" / "eight thousand one hundred forty five"

writing


a note on written varae
varae, in the world of lunatine, is written in a native script. however, for most meta purposes, it is romanized. the following rules are meant to adapt the written script into a more easily accessible format for learners and people interested in the world and its language.
the main speakers of varae are the Selhae, who have always had a very heavy focus on oral storytelling and music, as a culture. this means that the most common way something is passed along is verbally, and writing is not as common. some of these rules may seem unintuitive for long, detailed writing, but writing was generally reserved for preserving songs and stories, and communication between people (i.e. letters) - which all tended to be more poetic in nature.

prose forms
when written, periods are not used to mark the end of a sentence. instead, each new sentence is written on a new line.
instead of commas, written varae uses a tilde ~ to divide sentences into phrases/clauses. these are not always used depending on context, but are often added for clarity and when sentences become too long.
lines can be broken off after a ~ or a { to prevent it from running off the page or simply becoming unreadably long. this is not necessary on all sentences, even if it has multiple clauses. when this is done, the continuation on the next line is indented so as not to be confused with a new sentence.
in informal writing, or where it is not possible to break lines or indent, lines may be broken at any point and may not be indented. however, if this is done, any following lines must be separated with enough visual space to be able to tell where one line ends and another begins.
deii ~ otu vala dorafel anwaefa osu renaksii ~
	dorafel korliia dae weise nerasii veha
telasiira ~ deii yovela pahorii dala beirusii ~ 
	na iinyaniilfel hiimana fa vahes meikasii
ota deii lukasii nako karawesii ~ 
	na vala dae tayaso ne geralo sakakesii muhaelii
yiim deiifel kin ne teraniil asu keso
deii otu vala dorafel
anwaefa osu renaksii
dorafel korliia dae
weise nerasii veha
 
telasiira ~ deii yovela
pahorii dala beirusii
na iinyaniilfel hiimana
fa vahes meikasii
capitalization
romanized varae is written entirely in lower case, with no upper case letters.
quotes
quotes/quotations, in written varae, use curly brackets { } as quotation markers.
**"ota vaii beiso ~ deii vaii haraeso {koii aese mae vaiimosa}"
o-ta     vaii beiso ~    deii vaii harae-so koii koaese     mae  vaiimosa.**
REL-when 1SG  leave-PAS, 3SG  1SG  tell-PAS you  IMP-be-FUT safe please
"When I left, she told me, 'Please be safe.'"

LOCATIONS/Asilles/History.title: History
LOCATIONS/Asilles/History.content:
Asilles began as a World Seed planted in the World Garden, just as any planet did. Its caretakers, Anwi and Wefa, had been partners for a very long time.
As the world seed grew, life began to sprout - beautiful plant life and animals sprung up all across the planet. Anwi and Wefa decided that they had so much love for this planet, that they would gift to it sentient life as well. Anwi created the Selhae, and Wefa created the Fae - two sides of the same coin. They each had Souls, but each worked in a different way, with the Selhae’s working inwards towards the core of the soul, and the Fae’s working outwards towards the elements.
Life prospered on Asilles for a very long time. Societies began, grew, and fell many times over. Eventually, Anwi and Wefa noticed the Dust within the planet beginning to wane. It is part of the natural cycle of a planet - from seed, to world, and finally to a fully bloomed, newly born Inna. The caretakers knew this would come eventually - it is what they set out to do in the first place. However, Anwi and Wefa had gotten more attached to the life on their planet than most Inna tend to.
While most Inna see the world as a means to an end, just a step in the life cycle of the Inna, Anwi and Wefa saw it unfair that the people of Asilles would have to perish in order for them to create the new life they set out to create in the beginning. As the next, and last cycle of life began on Asilles, Anwi and Wefa created a plan.
From each of the 4 moons circling the planet - Kuraesmeris, Hiitomeris, Buromeris, and Folmeris - the caretakers took a stone and embedded it into an artifact they called the Moonband. From this moonband, they constructed a guardian of sorts - a construct of Moon - Merisdae.
Then, from the starlight that illuminated the planet, they created a gem of starlight. From this gem, they made a construct of Starlight - Yudora.
Merisdae and Yudora’s task would be to watch over the people of Asilles until the planet’s end truly came. When the end was near, Merisdae would choose a Selhae to guide the people from Asilles to the moons, and Yudora would choose a Fae fit to assist with cultivating life on these moons.

History
Asilles began as a World Seed planted in the World Garden, just as any planet did. Its caretakers, Anwi and Wefa, had been partners for a very long time.
As the world seed grew, life began to sprout - beautiful plant life and animals sprung up all across the planet. They each had Souls, but each worked in a different way, with the Selhae working inwards towards the core of the soul, and the Fae working outwards towards the elements.
Life prospered on Asilles for a very long time. Societies began, grew, and fell many times over. Eventually, Anwi and Wefa noticed the Dust within the planet beginning to wane. While most Inna see the world as a means to an end, just a step in the life cycle of the Inna, Anwi and Wefa saw it unfair that the people of Asilles would have to perish in order for them to create the new life they set out to create in the beginning. From each of the 4 moons circling the planet - Kuraesmeris, Hiitomeris, Buromeris, and Folmeris - the caretakers took a stone and embedded it into an artifact they called the Moonband. From this moonband, they constructed a guardian of sorts - a construct of Moon - Merisdae.

Economy
Asilles generally uses commodity money, aka money whose value comes from a commodity of which it is made.

i.e. gold, silver, copper

as well as commodity money, within small villages it is common to see a barter system.
goods often traded

food, animals - necessities
clothes, art, books - nonessentials

Technological Level

pre-industrial

Geography

85% water

LOCATIONS/Kohoii/index.title: Kohoii
LOCATIONS/Kohoii/index.content:
A small village along the Kohoii River in the southeast. It is surrounded by woods, and is nearby the border of the expansionist kingdom of Solei. The village has been in Solei’s sights for a very long time, leading to tense relations between the two.
Generic

Demographics
Kohoii is a small village of approximately 50-70Selhae.
History
Kohoii was one of the original Selhae settlements made by the first generation of Selhae. It was founded by three Selhae, who went on to form the three gaelii - Levenkagaelii, Daerikagaelii, and Gahinukagaelii.
Government
Kohoii is a very traditional Selhae settlement, meaning it is comprised of 3 overarching “gaelii” (families) - with the elder of each gaelii representing them in the Kohoii Council of Elders. These Elders are currently:


Council Elders


Reika of the Levenkagaelii

Esela is next in line.
Naediia was meant to be the next elder (and would be around the same age as the other elders) before her death.
She is the oldest of the elders, the last elder of her generation.
Reika is extremely traditionalist, strict, and does not like to compromise.



Paeyiilos of the Daerikagaelii

Soren is next in line.
Paeyiilos is more of a free spirit than Reika, less traditional.



Miire (and Mare) of the Gahinukagaelii

Miire is the effective elder, being the older twin, but Mare assists their twin and will take over in the event something happens to Miire.
The two are joined at the hip and never leave each others sides, but tend to butt heads often in their ideals.




The gaelii are not always related by blood, and tend to be larger than traditional families. Generally the elder of a gaelii will choose the next elder for their gaelii, and it is typically the current elder’s eldest child. However, it is not uncommon for the elder title to be transferred horizontally as well, for example passing the title to a sibling, cousin, or even close friend.
Overall, the whole village is very tight knit as well, and even people from other gaelii tend to be considered “family”.
Geography
The village lays along the Kohoii river, with most of the homes and shops on the west side of the river while the east side of the river holds the villages farmland.
The west side of the river is wooded, while the east side of the river is less tree-covered and leads into the plains further east. These plains made for easier farming, so the east side of Kohoii is mostly dedicated to agriculture - though the farmers do have homes on the farms as well.
Kohoii is a day’s travel from Raevat, a village to the east within the kingdom of Solei, and a week’s travel from Yuvomne, a larger independent settlement located further north along the river.

Infrastructure

In the wooded west side of Kohoii, there is a village center where there are a few shops, an inn, and an amphitheater, as well as the council house.
Outside of the village center, a few homes within close proximity of each other, as well as more spread out homes with more land dedicated to them the further you go out from the center.
The homes themselves tend to be small cottages, made of stone and wood.
There are two bridges across the river: one stone bridge at the village center where the river is wider, and a smaller, wooden bridge further north where the river narrows.

Technological Level
By the time the Kuraesmeris Migration comes to a close, it had been around 100 years. living in this completely new environment required rapid innovation in technology, with innovations such as steam power, electricity, and advanced transportation methods.
This is largely due to the fact that the settlers on Kuraesmeris brought with them a greater knowledge of technology and science than those who remained on Asilles. The settlers on Kuraesmeris also made use of their ability to manipulate Dust in new and innovative ways, creating devices that were powered by Dust and allowing for the creation of new technologies that were not possible on Asilles.
However, despite these advancements, there are still limits to what technology can accomplish on the moon, and much of the work is still done manually or with the help of simple machines.
Governance
the kuraesmeris settlement is treated as one large settlement, though comprised of a few cities.
the first group of Selhae to make it up to the moon formed a council, to govern the moons.

Esela was head of this council, with the guidance of Merisdae.

Maeniil
Alternative Names: Sanctuary
Type: Woods
Location Under:: Kohoii (Kohoii%205ec34e8227ec4373998d026fd09ee730.md)
a small clearing in the woods surrounding Kohoii. Esela visits this clearing often, giving it the name of Maeniil, or Sanctuary, as she is able to rest and enjoy her time here alone.

img. credit - Candlepowerforums

img. credit - alamy stock photo

img credit - Lizzy Forrester

the little house
when she was young, esela and her mother built a small hut/house in the maeniil, kind of like a treehouse but on the ground. when Kulith begins staying with esela in the maeniil to hide from Solei, she stays in this house.
it is becoming overgrown with moss and leaves, but the inside is full of esela’s knickknacks, flowers, books, etc. she spends more time here than anywhere else.

Council Elders


Reika of the Levenkagaelii

Esela is next in line.
Naediia was meant to be the next elder (and would be around the same age as the other elders) before her death.
She is the oldest of the elders, the last elder of her generation.
Reika is extremely traditionalist, strict, and does not like to compromise.



Paeyiilos of the Daerikagaelii

Soren is next in line.
Paeyiilos is more of a free spirit than Reika, less traditional.



Miire (and Mare) of the Gahinukagaelii

Miire is the effective elder, being the older twin, but Mare assists their twin and will take over in the event something happens to Miire.
The two are joined at the hip and never leave each others sides, but tend to butt heads often in their ideals.

ORGANIZATIONS/Seedkeeper-Council/index.title: index
ORGANIZATIONS/Seedkeeper-Council/index.content:
Seedkeeper Council
Created: December 20, 2024 11:50 AM
Members: Hafei (Hafei%20174c5cb610f580d88ee8cac629e93be4.md), Kasime (Kasime%20216c5cb610f580348b9bcb2c725c05d2.md), Wefa (Wefa%200d386a3f0d714b369130ebed9c6f58cd.md), Anwi (Anwi%20af7e2c72103f45cdbee264ff6beb0e57.md), Emeut (Emeut%2015fc5cb610f5804bbc41e9a30a552b29.md)
Owns: World Garden (World%20Garden%205a6cfe0468e64efe8e9b097f621b0ca2.md)
The council that presides over all Inna in order to maintain balance in The Expanse and hold up the Inna Tenets established by Hafei.
Made up of some of the most powerful Inna in existence, The Seedkeepers claim to rule over all Inna in the Expanse. However, as the Expanse is infinite, there are many Inna that travel far, far away from the Council’s watchful eyes to escape prosecution. These Inna often end up living in isolation.

tenets


The Inna Tenets

Neglect not the garden you have sown.

Care for your creations.


World seeds must not be neglected or treated badly. It can result in a weak, hurt Inna, which is cruel to the Inna and to the Expanse.


Creation leads to Endings, and Endings lead to Beginnings.

The cycle of created life must be respected.


All dust taken from the expanse must return to the expanse. Dust contributed to a world seed must return to the Inna that blooms from it.


Honor the connections between Inna.

All threads are connected.


Conflict between Inna is meaningless. All Inna work toward the same goal, and all Inna are connected through Dust.





structure


the seedkeepers
these inna work within the center of the world garden, directly governing the garden and

High Seedkeeper

Hafei
presides over the World Garden to maintain the balance of The Expanse  and uphold the Inna Tenets.


Garden Wardens

dole punishments to Inna breaking the tenets

punishments often include having dust taken from one’s Soul




Council Members

work with the High Seedkeeper to uphold the tenets






the fieldtenders
these inna work outside of the center of the world garden, to ensure inna are following the tenets even when not under direct supervision from the seedkeepers. they are technically not official seedkeepers, but report to them.

World Curators

Anwi and Wefa, among others
enforces Neglect not the garden you have sown.
travel the expanse, finding and inspecting any growing World Seeds to ensure they are not being neglected by their caretakers.


[name pending]

Emeut, among others
enforces Creation leads to Endings, and Endings lead to Beginnings.
travel the expanse to find any stray life that may have left a planet before the bloom of an inna, and ensure that inna are not intentionally disrupting the balance.


Thread Weavers

enforces Honor the connections between Inna.
essentially inna social workers lmfao makes sure everyone gets along and has what they need





history
The council began in good faith, as Hafei genuinely wanted to preserve the balance of the Expanse and bring meaning to the universe. The Tenets and the roles in the council were centered around ensuring worlds grew into strong Inna and continuing the cycle of creation.
However, over time, Hafei became obsessed with ensuring that he would always be around to “protect” the Expanse. He did not believe that any other Inna had the right or the ability to do it, so it became clear to him that he must remain alive until the universe came to its end.
Punishments became more severe and more frequent. Breaking any of the Tenets ran the risk of one’s dust being taken from their soul, and the seized dust would then be absorbed by Hafei to extend his life. These punished Inna were left with little to no soul dust, and were unable to continue growing planets. Dying, and with no purpose, these Inna would often become wanderers until they faded out of existence.
