SPECIES/Construct/index.title: Construct
SPECIES/Construct/index.content:
About
Constructs are magical beings created by the Selhae and the Inna. They come in many forms and can be made for various reasons, such as companionship or assistance.
They are created by imbuing an inanimate object with a piece of the creator’s soul and a great deal of magic. The soulpiece and magic are then pulled out of the object, resulting in a living being that can take on almost any form the creator wishes, including humanoid, animal, and mythical creature forms.
These Constructs are incredibly versatile and can fulfill various roles, depending on the reason they were created. Traditionally, Constructs were created as assistants or companions to help with work or to travel with their creators. However, many Selhae now create Constructs solely for companionship, sometimes taking on the role of a child or a pet. Constructs can also be designed to serve specific functions, such as guarding or providing medical assistance.
One of the advantages of Constructs is their ability to learn and adapt. They possess a level of intelligence that allows them to understand and perform complex tasks. With proper training, they can even exceed the capabilities of their creators. Additionally, Constructs do not experience fatigue or illness, making them ideal for work that requires long hours or exposure to harmful environments.
Basic Information
Anatomy & Morphology
Constructs can take on any form the creator desires. This is however limited by the amount of magic put into making the construct. For example, only putting the bare minimum amount of magic into making a construct will only allow you to create a construct that is small, like the size of a rodent or small mammal.
Perception & Sensory / Extrasensory Capabilities
Constructs are able to perceive and sense their surroundings based on the form they take. For example, if a construct takes on the form of a bird, it will have heightened vision and be able to fly. Constructs can also have extrasensory capabilities such as telepathy or the ability to sense magic, depending on the amount of magic imbued into them by their Selhae creator.
Genetics & Reproduction
Constructs do not reproduce or have genetics in the traditional sense. Instead, their appearance and mannerisms are influenced by the soulpiece used to create them. The larger the soulpiece, the more the Selhae’s soul influences the construct’s traits. As a result, some constructs may resemble either the Selhae or those who were close to them, as a soul is composed of the people close to you.
Growth Rate & Stages
Constructs do not age at all. Since they are connected to their creator’s soul, once the creator dies, the construct will either die with the creator, or the creator can imbue the rest of their soul into the construct and the construct will live on, aging like a Selhae until it dies of natural causes.
Ecology & Habitat
Constructs do not have specific ecological or habitat needs since they do not require sustenance or a living environment. They exist solely to serve their Selhae creator, and their activities are generally limited to the tasks assigned to them. Constructs can travel with their Selhae creators, but they do not require a specific environment to survive.
Extended
Average Intelligence
Constructs possess a level of intelligence that allows them to understand and perform complex tasks. They can learn and adapt through proper training and can even exceed the capabilities of their creators.
Average Physique
Constructs can take on any form the creator desires, depending on the amount of magic imbued into them. The more magic put into making a construct, the larger and more complex its form can be.
Uses, Byproducts and Exploitation
Constructs are created to assist their Selhae creators in various tasks, such as work or travel. They are not exploited or used for any other purpose beyond their intended function.

Myths and Legends
Descendants of the original Fae created by Wefa passed down The Story of the Inna.
The original fae were not so social as to create clans like their Selhae counterparts, so the Inna’s story is simply passed from parent to child.
The Fae believe that they were given Elemental Magic as a way to connect with the world created by the Inna. They believe that their magical abilities allow them to communicate with the elements and understand the world on a deeper level.
The Fae see themselves as a bridge between the Inna and the world they created, and they take pride in their ability to interpret the will of the Inna and act accordingly.
Art
The Fae tend to focus on more physical art, such as weaving, painting, sculpting, pottery, and woodworking. They have a deep appreciation for the natural world and often incorporate elements of nature into their art, such as using wood and stone from the environment to create sculptures or using natural dyes to color their textiles.

SPECIES/Inna/index.title: Inna
SPECIES/Inna/index.content:
Star Walkers
About
Ancient cosmic beings who plant the seeds of new worlds in their Garden, and from those worlds spring newborn Inna. Rarely do they visit these worlds in person, but on such occasions they will hide their true form and blend in among the locals, indistinguishable save for their planetary eyes.
The oldest Inna has been around since the beginning of the universe, made purely of Dust. They awoke to an empty void, The Expanse - and used their unique gift of Creation to give meaning to the universe. They created the World Seeds, ultra-compressed pockets of dust used to grow worlds, to plant in the World Garden. These World seeds become planets, and at the end of their lifecycle, the seed finally flowers - and a new Inna is born from the dying world.
Since the first Inna, worlds have come and gone - planets once flourishing with life transformed into new Inna, who keep the cycle going. Traditionally, Inna are given permission by their caretakers - the Inna who planted their seed - to cultivate their own world seed, though this is not always the case. Some Inna choose not to grow worlds, and some go against their caretakers will and do so independently.
Inna rarely visit their worlds personally, and will sometimes create Constructs using Construction to watch over their seeds for them.
Generic

Anatomy & Morphology
The Inna are large, abstract beings - created fully of Soul dust, they normally do not contain any Essence to provide them with a physical form that would be recognizable as a living creature. They are often depicted as clouds of dust, or galaxies full of stars, as they are made up of the universe.
They do have the ability to take on any form they wish. Sometimes, Inna will appear in the shape of the creatures on their world, and observe the planet from within.
Perception & Sensory / Extrasensory Capabilities
Inna have a unique gift of Creation, which they use to grow worlds from World Seed . Additionally, they have the power of Construction. Some Inna use this ability to create constructs to assist in tending to their seed.
Genetics & Reproduction
Inna are born from worlds at their end, which flower into new Inna. Traditionally, Inna are given permission by their caretakers - the Inna who planted their seed - to cultivate their own world seed, though this is not always the case. Some Inna choose not to grow worlds, and some go against their caretakers will and do so independently.
Inna will often grow worlds together with others they care about, such as a romantic partnership, a strong friendship, a sibling or family member. These units can be as small or as large as the Inna wishes - some Inna take the burden of creation on their shoulders alone, and some will grow their world seed together with the support of many others. Sometimes, multiple of these units will all grow seeds together in the same vicinity, and share resources like a sun.
The lifespan of the world/world seed depends on the Inna cultivating it. Some Inna do not care much for the world - only using it as a means to grow a new Inna. Some, however, care deeply about the world they create and see it as an important phase of the Inna cycle. These latter Inna may decide to create life on their worlds for this reason.
Worlds grown by the former may appear bleak, desolate, and devoid of life. To these Inna, the world is a means to an end - what happens in between when the seed is planted and when the seed blooms doesn’t matter to them. The seed must still be given the bare amount of attention, as world seeds do have the possibility of dying before they can bloom.
Contrastingly, worlds grown by attentive and caring Inna will be lush, prospering worlds with animal and plant life - and occasionally sentient life as well if the caretakers wish. Some Inna believe that the better you care for the world seed, the more well-off the Inna will be when it is born.
Growth Rate & Stages

world seed

the core of a world. super compact and powerful dust


growing planet
waning planet
bloomed inna
waning inna

their dust will wane over time, causing the inna to weaken
powerful inna are able to absorb more dust when theirs begin to wane so they can keep themselves alive for longer


death

if all of an inna’s dust wanes, the inna would fade out of existence.

Inna are named by their caretakers upon their birth. Each name is unique and is meant to reflect the Inna’s personality and role in the universe.
In some cases, Inna may choose to change their names as they grow and evolve. This is typically done to reflect a change in the Inna’s role or personality, or to signify a significant event in their life. However, these name changes are rare and are only done under special circumstances.

SPECIES/Selhae/index.title: Selhae
SPECIES/Selhae/index.content:
About
A species created by Anwi to live upon the planet Asilles.
Generic
Anatomy & Morphology
The Selhae are a species resembling our Earth’s own humans, alike in almost every manner. Physically, Selhae have a wider range of natural hair and eye colors, but skin color and other features are very much the same.
Growth Rate & Stages
Selhae are a very long-lived species. They can live upwards of 600-700 years, sometimes even longer if healthy. They age similarly to humans up until around age 20, at which rate their aging slows down. At this rate, roughly every 20-30 years is equivalent to 1 year of a human aging.
The point at which a Selhae’s aging slows is when they are considered an “adult”, and there is usually a coming-of-age celebration.
Genetics & Reproduction
Selhae are able to reproduce until very late in life, due to their aging slowing down after age 20. Generally speaking, they can reproduce until they are around 400 years old.

Myths and Legends
As the Inna took a very real part in the creation of Asilles, the creation mythos tends to be pretty close to reality.
Descendants of the original Selhae created by Anwi passed down The Story of the Inna. These original Selhae created the clans as they’re known today, and the head/elder of the clans are usually direct descendants of these original Selhae clan heads.
The story of the Inna is taught by the heads of the clans to the children of the clan/settlement, to pass the story on.
The Selhae believe that they were gifted the power of Construction to aid in their mission of making the world a worthy place for the Inna to return to. They believe that their duty is to shape the world according to the Inna’s will and prepare it for their eventual return. The Selhae see themselves as caretakers of the world, and they take their role very seriously.
Art
Selhae place great value on music and oral storytelling in their culture. These traditions are deeply ingrained in their society and serve to connect the people to their history and to each other.
One way in which these stories and tales are preserved is through the use of ballads and music. These ballads and songs are often passed down through the generations, ensuring that the traditions and stories of the Selhae are not lost over time.
In addition to ballads and music, the Selhae also use storytelling as a means of teaching and passing on knowledge. Through these oral stories, the Selhae are able to share important lessons and values with younger generations, ensuring that their culture and way of life are preserved for years to come.

STORY/ch1---draft-1.title: ch1 - draft 1
STORY/ch1---draft-1.content:
ch1 - draft 1
“Ah, ow!!”
A prick with a needle always hurt more than it ought to, but this time it was simply the shock of being pricked that caused Esela to finally pay attention. In her recoil, she dropped the needle, which she had been so carefully using to embroider tiny flowers along the edge of one of her previously-plain dresses. She may not be a skilled seamstress, but she could at least give her clothes a little flair with some handiwork - the same flair she gives to everything she can get her hands on.
With the drop of the needle, Esela’s attention was finally pulled away from her hard work, and down to the ground to find the needle. It hadn’t landed in her lap, and the tall grass and wildflowers beneath her obscured the ground and sealed this poor needle’s fate to become one with nature.
With a sigh in frustration, Esela closed her eyes and threw her head back to lean up against her tree. She didn’t have any more needles - all of her others had met similar fates along her tremulous embroidery-learning journey. As she opened her eyes, and got a glimpse of the sky through the canopy of leaves above her, Esela realized just how long she had been entranced in her Embroidery Fugue.
Last she had looked at the sky, it was just past noon. By now, the sky was beginning to grow dark, and the moons were starting to become visible.
“Oh, crap, it’s already sundown??” She muttered under her breath as she shot herself up onto her feet. Esela knew she was always alone in the maeniil - her safe place, so she felt more than comfortable speaking aloud to herself, narrating her seemingly never-ending inner monologue. “I just know Adela is going to be so upset with me this time. I can’t believe I forgot again…”
As much as she would have enjoyed spending the rest of the evening in her favorite spot in all of Asilles, embroidering and ignoring the world, she unfortunately had other responsibilities to take care of. Her grandmother, Village Elder Reika, had expected Esela to be back at home hours ago. She was supposed to help her with planning the harvest festival happening in her village of Kohoii that was just a few days away.
Esela quickly dusted off her layered pink, purple, and white dress and grabbed her things - her embroidery hoop and threads, as well as a small pouch - from her comfortable spot on the ground. Once everything was gathered, she took a deep breath, closed her eyes, and focused all of her energy on visualizing her room in her grandmother’s cottage. Esela could almost feel the tingles of the Dust within her resonating with her vivid memory of her childhood bedroom.
She had lived with her grandmother for as long as she could remember, which was made obvious by the sheer amount of things in her tiny cottage room. She had what most Selhae in her village would have in their room: a bed, a dresser, a bookcase - but Esela was also somewhat of a collector. Not only did she collect physical things like trinkets and books, her walls were lined with shelves full of them, but she also collected hobbies and crafts.
Her room was filled to the brim with flowers of all kinds - Gardenias being her favorite - from when she wanted to be a gardener or a florist. Her closet was full of half-finished dresses from her (failed) attempt at learning to sew, and lining the wall were baskets upon baskets of yarn from her foray into knitting and crochet. There was an easel by the window, set up with a blank canvas in the event she ever decided to try to paint again. And at her small desk, were piles of journals she either would use as diaries or attempt to write stories. Everything she did seemed to be temporary, only holding her attention for so long before she got tired of it, and moved onto the next.
One thing that had always kept Esela’s attention, though, was music. She had written many songs, some for performing, some just for herself. Her desk was scattered with all of the sheet music that she was working on.
And when she opened her eyes, there she was. Though, she didn’t appear in the center of the room or on her bed like she was expecting her teleportation powers to take her, but instead appeared on top of her already cluttered desk. Her trailing thoughts had distracted her enough to throw off her accuracy, and she stumbled into her room, toppling the stacks of books and journals and tripping herself to the ground with a crash.
From the other room, there was a quick, startled gasp, and then someone called out to her.
“Sela? Is that you in there??” The frail, concerned voice made it clear that her grandmother must have heard her stumble in.
Obviously used to Esela’s antics by now, her grandmother made her way straight to Esela’s room to check if her granddaughter had finally reappeared hours after she was supposed to be home. The door to her room was thrown open, and as soon as Reika saw Esela’s pink hair and dress in a pathetic pile on the ground surrounded by clutter, she breathed a sigh of relief.
“No use asking you where you’ve been, we both know where you were. We were all waiting for you earlier, you couldn’t even let us know?” Reika scolded, her wrinkled face contorted into an expression that made Esela unsure if Reika was angry, worried, or both. She would assume both.
Esela sat herself up on the floor, and looked up at Reika’s stern figure guiltily. “I-, I’m sorry, Adela, I lost track of the time again…” she stuttered, knowing full well this wasn’t the first time and more likely than not wouldn’t be the last.
“You can be sorry all you want, but being sorry won’t give me back all the time it took to convince Soren to help me instead. Wouldn’t lift their eyes from their books even for a moment, I don’t know how you get anything out of them.” Reika said with a smirk. That sounded about right, for Soren. Soren was another kid who grew up in Kohoii with Esela - only a few years younger than her. They had been friends since they were young, though their relationship had been more akin to cousins. “They’re always eager to help out when you’re around, Sela. You must have some sort of trick with them.”
“No tricks, all you have to do is be a little older than someone and they look up to you, I suppose. They just like to try to impress me, always been like that.”
Reika chuckled. “Don’t you think I’m quite old enough for that to work for me, hm?”
“A little older and a lot older is a big difference.” Esela retorted with a smirk as she picked herself up off of the ground.
Reika feigned offense at the jab with an exaggerated gasp and a clutch at her chest. Esela was always grateful Reika had at least a sense of humor, or else her scoldings would feel much worse. The two of them laughed for a moment before being interrupted by the whistle of a kettle coming from the kitchen.
“Oh, all your ruckus made me forget about my tea!” she turned towards the door, talking to Esela over her shoulder. “I need to get that - get yourself freshened up and come out for dinner when you’re done.”
“Okay, Adela, I will.”
“And you look a mess, by the way. You’re going to need to wash that dress tonight, it’s covered it dirt!” Now she was just stalling.
“Okay, Adela.” Esela said exasperatedly.
Reika gave her a smile, and closed the door to her room. When she heard her footsteps retreating to the kitchen, Esela tossed herself onto her bed.
She may have been joking around with her, but Esela knew that Reika was still upset with her. Being the elder of the village, Reika had many responsibilities that would be passed down to Esela when… that time came. She knew it was a great honor, being able to take over for her grandmother to lead the village she had grown up in and loved. But the responsibility of it all was something that Esela was having a hard time accepting she could handle and was worthy of.
Under normal circumstances, Esela’s mother, Naediia, would have been next in line to be elder, after Reika. But, when Naediia passed, that responsibility was given to Esela, instead - who was only a young child at the time. At first she was eager to take after her grandmother, but as she got older, the weight of the responsibility began to weigh on her.
Because, as much as she wished the responsibility of village elder just required her to plan festivals, there were much more pressing matters at hand, as well - the most pressing of them being Solei’s attempts to annex Kohoii.
Kohoii had always been an independent settlement, founded by Reika’s grandparents. The neighboring kingdom, Solei, had always been quite imperialistic - and has on many occasions tried to take Kohoii into their kingdom. Kohoii was not meant to be owned by another - and so they resisted, over and over again. There were many attacks on Kohoii - and it was in one of these battles that Esela’s mother had died. Solei had gained a powerful asset - a child, whose powers went far beyond the abilities of any normal Selhae.
Reika has held much resentment towards Solei since then, though the attacks have halted in recent years. Solei has had bigger issues to deal with than annexing a small village, much to the relief of the people of Kohoii. But the threat of another attack has always loomed over them.
Esela sighed and sat herself up at the edge of the bed - she should probably get ready for dinner like her grandmother had asked. She had already, albeit unintentionally, ignored her requests once today - it certainly would do no good to ignore her again.

STORY/plot-draft.title: plot draft
STORY/plot-draft.content:
plot draft ig?
inna arc
in the beginning, there was nothing, and then there was The Expanse. the expanse was vast, and empty, save for Dust . from the dust came Hafei, the first of the Inna. the inna are cosmic beings, made entirely of dust. not omnipotent or omniscient, but regarded like gods due to the immense amount of dust that they consist of making them extremely powerful.
to give meaning to the then-empty void, hafei created the World Garden. World Seeds are planted in the garden, and from the seeds grow new worlds. at the natural end of the world, a newborn inna blossoms from the seed.
together with the first few inna born in the garden, hafei forms the Seedkeeper Council to govern over the inna. the council puts into place a set of tenets that all inna must follow.

The Inna Tenets

Neglect not the garden you have sown.,

Care for your creations.,
World seeds must not be neglected or treated badly. It can result in a weak, hurt Inna, which is cruel to the Inna and to the Expanse.


Creation leads to Endings, and Endings lead to Beginnings.,

The cycle of created life must be respected.,
All dust taken from the expanse must return to the expanse. Dust contributed to a world seed must return to the Inna that blooms from it.,


Honor the connections between Inna.,

All threads are connected.,
Conflict between Inna is meaningless. All Inna work toward the same goal, and all Inna are connected through Dust.




inna who don’t follow these tenets get punished, usually by having some or all of their dust confiscated by the Garden Wardens . losing dust means losing power, and life. lose all of your dust, and you cease to exist.
unbeknownst to most inna, this dust that is being confiscated from rule-breakers is actually being given to hafei to extend his life. powerful inna that are close to hafei tend to hold the same beliefs as him, but many inna do not agree with his practices. some inna do not believe all life on a planet should end with the bloom of an inna, and believe the inna and the people of its seed can and should exist at the same time.
hafei has been around long enough and has absorbed enough dust throughout that time that he is much stronger than any inna that has tried to dissent, but he cannot be everywhere at once. so, he enlists many inna to become the  the fieldtenders - spread out across the expanse to uphold each of the tenets for hafei.
Anwi and Wefa are part of the World Curators, meaning they travel the expanse checking on worlds being grown to ensure they’re growing well and not being neglected.
Emeut is part of the [name pending], who travel the expanse to find any stray life that may have left a planet before the bloom of an inna, and ensure that inna are not intentionally disrupting the balance.
emeut is a relatively powerful inna, that has been around for a while (not as long as hafei but longer than many inna). he has been harboring very extremist ideals, that inna should not be so concerned with the care of their seeds, and should be making as many inna as possible -regardless of how neglected they are - to fill the expanse. while under the guise of working for the council, he has been using his dust to essentially “fund” other inna’s worlds for his own means. this has gained him many followers.
Anwi and Wefa check up on Emeut as part of their job and find that he has been neglecting many world seeds and creating essentially an army of inna to try to overthrow hafei. emeut had convinced many other inna to help him create many world seeds that they ultimately would not put any care into, just so they would bloom as soon as possible and become inna to work and fight for emeut when the time came for his coup.
when this is found out, anwi and wefa report it to the council and emeut is punished severely by the garden wardens, and has most of his dust taken away. other world curators are sent out to investigate and ensure whoever was working with emeut gets punished as well. this not only fuels emeut’s anger towards the council and hafei, but also towards anwi and wefa.
some time later, Anwi and Wefa plant their own world seed together. this seed sprouts into the planet Asilles. 4 moons sprouted around the planet as well - Kuraesmeris / crescentmoon, Hiitomeris / bluemoon, Buromeris / bloodmoon, and Folmeris / fullmoon.
as the planet grows, the pair decide to gift it sentient life as well. they each use their power of Creation to create beings to live on the planet, each with Souls that work in different ways.
anwi creates the Selhae . selhae souls work inwards, towards the core of the self. selhae resonate with Soul -type dust. the selhae received two gifts from anwi: Construction, which allows the selhae to create constructs by using a piece of their soul, and Soul Archetypes, which provide the selhae with unique powers and abilities determined by the resonance of their soul
wefa creates the Fae . fae souls work outwards, towards the elements. fae resonate with Essence -type dust. the fae similarly received two gifts from wefa: Shapeshifting, which allows the fae to take on many forms, and Elemental Magic, which provides fae with the ability to manipulate elements that resonate with their soul.
at first, anwi and wefa play a very active role on asilles. the selhae and fae regard the inna as gods. however, as more inna are creating planets, anwi and wefa are needed more often to do their job for the seedkeepers. as time passes, they get very attached to their creations and don’t want them to have to all perish when the planet wanes and their new inna baby blooms, so they figure out a plan to save the life on the planet before it dies - they construct two guardians to watch over the planet and assist when the time came.
Merisdae  - will choose a selhae to guide the people to the moons, and Yudora - will choose a fae to establish life on the moons.
asilles arc
a looong time later, (like tens or hundreds of thousands of years later or smth), asilles begins to wane naturally, signaling the end of the planet’s lifespan. this happens very slowly. it isn’t really noticable by the people on asilles, but they might start noticing that the waning of dust from the planet is affecting their crops, etc.
emeut finds out about anwi and wefa’s plan to save the people of asilles and decides to sabotage them because that is Wrong and disrupts the balance of the universe (and also because he wants revenge). however, due to his dust being taken from him, he doesn’t have much power left. he decides he will take Atis, one of his follower’s long dead and neglected planets, and chuck it at asilles send it on a course directly into asilles, destroying the planet, the selhae and the fae, and the growing inna. compared to asilles, atis is small - but large enough to do major damage to the planet. it is more comparable in size to an asteroid or a moon. he doesn’t do this immediately, since at this point anwi and wefa are much more powerful than him. they would need to be out of the way for him to enact his plan.
meanwhile, due to asilles’ dust waning, a panic in losing their crops and resources and needing to obtain more means of production kickstarts the selhae kingdom of Solei to begin taking over more settlements (and in turn, kickstarts the Kohoii/Solei War)
Kulith is born in solei, and at a young age is discovered by the solei government for her abnormally high concentration of dust and strong powers of manipulating sound waves. as a child, kulith is stolen bought from her parents and is used as a weapon in the war. notably, she is used in an attack on Kohoii, which kills Naediia - Esela’s mother.
Esela was born in Kohoii, a small village headed by her grandmother Reika . after her mother passed in the conflict with solei, reika raised esela on her own to be next in line to lead kohoii. esela cared deeply about the village, but didn’t feel that she was fit to be its leader. esela spends a lot of her time in a place she calls the Maeniil - “sanctuary” in varae - a clearing in the woods near kohoii known only to her.
years after the attack on kohoii, when kulith and esela were adults, kulith is able to escape solei and runs away. she stumbles upon esela in the maeniil and esela agrees to help hide kulith when solei inevitably comes looking for her. the two of them get super close and super gay for each other
one day, esela decides to bring kulith to kohoii, to show her the village she was meant to lead. kulith was apprehensive, knowing that kohoii and solei were at war - but trusted esela and wanted to learn about the village she was forced to attack from such a young age.
however, reika, being around for the entirety of solei’s oppression, attempted annexation, and attacks, did not have the brightest outlook when it came to people from the kingdom to begin with - but reika recognized kulith as the girl who killed her daughter. knowing this sealed kulith’s fate to reika. furious, reika sends kulith away and tells esela what kulith had done all those years ago.
esela is (fairly) super distraught and runs to the maeniil, only to find kulith waiting for her. the two of them talk and kulith explains that she was used against her will, and that’s why she had run away. after a lot of consideration, esela forgives her, and they decide to run away from kohoii to be together.
soon after this, merisdae chooses esela as the selhae guide, linking merisdae and esela’s souls.
years pass, and esela and kulith settle down in Yuvomne and have their daughter, Kaeyomii. at a young age, kaeyomii began seeing visions of Atis and the destruction of the planet. kaeyomii tells esela and kulith about these visions, but as they are unaware of her rare archetype/powers at this time, they believe she is just an imaginative child and don’t give it much thought. however, through her link to esela, merisdae is made aware of atis and of kaeyomii’s ability to see into the future.
merisdae realizes that she needs help in order to attempt to save asilles from the impact of the debris - or at least perform damage control and make sure as little damage is done as possible. she knows, through her link with esela, that esela has teleportation abilities and kaeyomii can see the future. she also knows yudora has [insert special barrier/blast powers here]. her plan is to recruit esela, kaeyomii and yudora and amplify their abilities.
kaeyomii, being able to see the debris impact happen ahead of time, would inform the group of the location of impact so they can focus their efforts. amplified by merisdae - clearer visions
esela would teleport the group close to the impact site, and work to evacuate anyone in danger away from the site. amplified by merisdae - further teleportation range
yudora would blast the debris away, hopefully either breaking the debris into smaller pieces, or, preferably, pushing the debris far enough away that it would no longer fall to asilles at all. amplified by merisdae - stronger blast
the group is teleported right outside the blast radius, with kaeyomii’s navigational help. esela and kulith leave kaeyomii in what they believe to be a safe hiding spot outside of the range of the impact, and tell her not to leave no matter what until they come back. esela and kulith work on evacuating anyone living in the danger zone, and yudora and merisdae get prepared to blast the meteor away.
emeut, already upset that his meteor missed, interferes further and speeds up the debris. doing this is much riskier to him - throwing atis from afar would ensure he was not caught when anwi and wefa returned, but getting this close to the planet made it hard to dismiss the blame. kaeyomii didn’t see this in any of her visions, so it was not accounted for.
panicking, yudora and merisdae get ready to blast the debris away, but… the blast is not strong enough, and the debris simply resumes falling back to the planet… some falling directly to where kaeyomii was hiding.
the debris impacts with asilles.
with moments to spare, merisdae is able to reach kaeyomii at the impact site and, while she’s not able to save her physical form, merisdae absorbs kaeyomii’s soul into her own. merisdae and yudora are deconstructed by the force of the impact, leaving only the Moonband and Starlight Crystal? behind. esela and kulith, now outside of the blast radius, survive the impact.
anwi and wefa return to asilles. they catch emeut, who is at this point fading out of existence. in his final words to anwi and wefa, emeut tells them of his suspicion that hafei is taking inna’s dust for himself, to make himself stronger and live forever.
with esela’s link to merisdae, she knows that something went wrong and that she needs to go find kaeyomii. when they get back to the impact site, they’re unable to find even kaeyomii’s body in the rubble. the two are devastated at the loss of their child and to the destruction of the planet.
however, esela finds the moonband and reconstructs merisdae with her own soulpiece. she returns in her “simpler” form, due to no longer having an inna’s soulpiece.
kulith finds the starlight crystal and reconstructs yudora with her own soulpiece as well, who also returns in a simpler form.
anwi and wefa, now fully able to see what has happened to their planet, their world seed - see that the impact of the debris has accelerated the death of the planet. this means the dust on the planet will be increasingly absorbed into the seed, until nothing is left and the seed blooms into a new inna. merisdae and yudora see this as well, and know that it is time for them to perform the duties they were constructed to do, and migrate the population of asilles up to its moons.

STORY/rough-rough-draft-from-before-outl.filePath: STORY/rough rough draft from before outline.md
STORY/rough-rough-draft-from-before-outl.title: rough rough draft from before outline
STORY/rough-rough-draft-from-before-outl.content:
rough rough draft from before outline
[esela is in the maeniil, sitting on the ground and leaning up against a tree. she is embroidering. she is very focused on her work. she blinks a few times, her eyes adjusting to the low light, and finally seems to notice that the sun has gone down. ]
esela : where did the time go!? i swear, it was just noon..
[she scrambles up and tries to get her things together. she runs into her little hut thing to put her stuff away and grab what she needs to take home.]
[esela teleports herself back to her room in her grandmother’s cottage in kohoii. she stumbles out of the teleport, making enough noise to let reika know she was here]
reika : “sela, is that you??”
[esela can hear reikas footsteps getting closer, until she flings open the door to esela’s room, and breathes a sigh of relief.]
reika : “it is you! where have you been??”
[reika sounds angry, but she is mostly concerned and stressed. she runs up to esela and pulls her into a tight hug.]
esela : “i.. i’m sorry, adela, i lost track of the time..”
reika : “this just keeps happening, esela..! you were supposed to be back hours ago. how are we going to get anything done in time if you’re going to go missing every time we need you?”
[esela feels super guilty. she looks like a kicked puppy :pweasey: :pleadingface: :uncursedcry:. reika sighs and calms down a bit, then tries to lighten the mood a little and starts to head towards the door.]
reika : “anyways, the work has already been done. i was, surprisingly, able to convince [reika’s construct] to step away from his paperwork for two seconds and help me out. it’s like pulling teeth with him, trying to get him to do anything else!”
[esela lets out a light giggle.]
esela : “that sounds like him, alright. does he ever take a break? does he even sleep?”
[reika chuckles.]
reika : “if he does, he sure doesn’t let me know.”
[teapot screams from the other room]
reika : “ah, that’s my tea. dinner will be ready soon, so freshen up, okay?” (lighthearted) “you look a mess!”
[esela realizes the scrambling before and tumbling into her room had caused her hair to go awry, not to mention the dirt on her dress from sitting in the maeniil.]
esela : “i will… i’ll be out in a few.”
[reika leaves the room and closes the door behind her. as soon as she is alone, esela falls back onto her bed. she stares up at her ceiling.]
esela : i keep messing these things up… why does she still think i can do this? no matter how much i mess up…….

pando’s-charater-analysis.title: pando’s charater analysis
pando’s-charater-analysis.content:
pando’s character analysis??
lia’s analysis
esela is next in line but is afraid, though not enough to betray her duties (yet) and kulith is this child soldier that just got out of her binds, great start
esela i assume has barely left her village, so she knows people, or would i assume is at least very close to a few
this is what i assume keeps her around
and now kulith has no idea where she is, i assume (how much of the land does she know if she just fights the battles?) and needs help from this person who only really knows her own village, so that’s the only idea of a place to take a look at and hopefully figure out what to do next (this gives kulith another reason to go to kohoii)
the chunks between this and any other significant event is probably exposition of character - bonding, learning about the characters as individuals instead of just who they are around each other, the good stuff
esela falling in love makes sense if she’s a romantic, a chance meeting with a stranger in her hut is perfect for her
but her struggles with the relationship probably come from being torn between that and her village and responsibilities, how easy is all of that to let go after it’s been laid out in front of you for your entire life?
bc kulith was bought and used as a weapon, how much free will and thought did she have for herself?? it’s mind-numbing stuff, so i imagine her emotions get easily subdued, and even when she feels them, who’s even listening?
i’d think that opening up takes time, even in the time that they spend learning about each other in the hut before the festival, how much is kulith really gonna open up about?
how can someone like that trust others, and if she’s unwilling to open up enough, how is esela even falling for her anyway?
i think it kinda depends on kulith’s personality at this point in time, just after escaping
is she trying to open up and be trusting of others? or is she closed off and edgy bc she’s only known violence for so long?
it could be a mix of both, and these clashing feelings of hers make it difficult for her to express herself more than it already is
and it could give esela mixed signals
but i imagine kulith isn’t coming right out and going “yeah so i’m a murderer”
i mean she could
but i think that is not the direction you’d want to go if you want esela to be willing to talk to her
so she’s holding back when they’re getting to know each other in the hut, she has to tread carefully and listen to what she’s saying bc if she trips up and this person she’s beginning to trust leaves her, then she’s got no one again
this can be where she realizes she’s feeling something, but is it a crush? does she know what that feels like? this has to be it, right? but really, how in love could she be when the other person is treating her in a way that they would to a non-murderer?
as far as feelings go, kulith could go back and forth on if her feelings are out of gratefulness and admiration or actual love
it’s new to her, i’d assume, and after having to tamp down your feelings in order to fight, it can’t be an easy thing to navigate
anyway, eventually they’ll go to the festival, however you want to get them there
beyond that, idk where you’re headed with plot, but at some point i imagine kulith’s background gets revealed
i’m sure it’s a big struggle for them both, bc kulith is now attached to esela, the only person she’s really got and is slowly realizing she’s scared to lose. she loses esela, she’s literally lost all she has aside from some sick fighting skills
and esela now has a murderer she’s fallen in love with, and that murderer happened to be there when her mom died and caused so much grief for the village she’s grown up in and loves
lots to unpack between them
if this story is going anywhere esela is gonna have to forgive kulith, i assume with the trust that kulith has truly changed and isn’t gonna go attacking her village again
and kulith is gonna be real stressed about this for a while, bc all of these feelings don’t just dissipate the moment you say them out loud
bc idk how the story unfolds, i can’t say much more on what could happen
but kulith would get the most character development out of all this
i imagine by the time she’s confessed about who she is and what she’s done, she’s a much more open person, at least to esela
and that esela’s opened up to her as well
so then the whole running away thing
who brings it up?
esela? bc she’s tired just from the idea of being the next elder? or kulith? bc she just wants to be with esela without the family hate?
my personal vote is esela, bc again, it gives kulith some more character development, but now esela has her time to shine with her struggles instead of kulith now
esela brings up the idea, albeit with her reservations, it’s just an idea after all
kulith, as much as you might imagine is on board for this, cares about esela now
so why would she let the person she likes throw away the life she’s lived?
kulith knows what it’s like to be alone, but esela’s always had people around her
esela can have the power and authority that kulith never had and lived under all her life, why shouldn’t esela take what she can get?
now that kulith is more in tune with her feelings, at this point, we can finally see her express them
and they’re all about esela
obviously
but esela’s pretty set on not wanting to be the next elder, so they’ll have to find a way around it
that is for you to figure out story wise
arguments, understanding, whatever needs to be done for esela and kulith to be like “okay we can run away without regrets, or at least not a lot of them” and skip off into the sunset
maybe they do leave with regrets, but they can go make up with reika later if they gotta (that’s a whole other story i think)
my analysis of the analysis

esela is next in line to be village elder

she is afraid, but not enough to betray her duties (yet)
what keeps her around is the people of kohoii, she barely has left kohoii otherwise


kulith is essentially a child soldier who just escaped

she doesn’t really know anything about where she is. she runs away but doesn’t know where she’s planning on running to, just away


exposition of character

bonding
learning abt the characters as individuals instead of just who they are around each other


esela is a romantic

she has a meetcute with a stranger in her little hideout and is like “destiny brought us together”
but she is also torn because her responsibilities with kohoii have been something that is very important for a long time in her life


kulith was bought from her parents and used as a weapon for solei

didn’t have much free will
for a majority of her life she wasn’t allowed to have emotions, essentially
her emotions get easily subdued, and even when she feels them, who’s even listening?


how much is kulith gonna open up about?

at first she’s pretty aloof, grateful to esela for helping her hide but is not very open about her past
esela’s more open and kind nature kind of gets through kulith’s walls a bit, and she starts opening up a little over time
kulith had been very closed off for her whole life and shes decided that she needs to change for her own sake and let others in
she’s holding back when they’re getting to know each other in the hut
she has to tread carefully and listen to what she’s saying bc if she trips up and this person she’s beginning to trust leaves her, then she’s got no one again


when feelings start arising

esela accepts them easily but doesn’t want to overstep and tries to hide it a bit, but is really bad at it
kulith on the other hand doesn’t really know what she’s feeling because she’s never really experienced anything like it before
kulith goes back and forth on if her feelings are out of gratefulness and admiration or actual love
its kinda the first test of letting herself feel things and not supressing them


festival time

this is gonna be like, the culmination of things and i think where i want to have one of them confess to the other or smth
it can be a big bonding thing and kulith is finally seeing kohoii, which is very important to esela
i think at this point kulith is finally like. dang if she is so attached to this place she deserves to know what i did
but maybe reika finds them before kulith gets a chance to tell her, and esela finds out from reika instead of kulith


conflictttttt

esela is upset about what kulith did and that kulith didn’t tell her herself
reika bans kulith from returning to kohoii and says that esela cannot see her anymore
kulith fuckin books it so as not to be turned in or captured by reika or anything. she needs to be free she cannot get herself in trouble again
esela is hella upset and goes to be alone in the maeniil and criesss
kulith shows up and they have a Talk ™️… kulith explains everything that happened that was beyond her control bc she was essentially brainwashed
esela is upset obviously but still has feelings for kulith regardless and knows that she can’t avoid them
kiss..? :pweasey:


esela decides to keep hiding kulith at the maeniil. reika doesn’t know about this still so kulith is safe there

but that safety doesn’t last long because soren finds the maeniil and kulith in the hut and snitches to reika
reika then makes soren go and destroy the hut (how? burning it??) while they arent there
esela and kulith come back to the maeniil to it destroyed (keep in mind this was like. esela’s ONLY safe space she built the hut with her mom and would be here like literally all the time)
esela freaks out and goes to reika, who admits that she had soren do it so she couldn’t keep hiding kulith from her
this is kinda the last straw and esela is like “i cant do this. i need to leave”


esela brings up the idea to run away, albeit with her reservations

she loves kohoii but knows she is not ready to be the leader and can’t handle reika’s cruelty regarding kulith who she cares about a lot
kulith is hesitant because she knows that esela cares a lot about kohoii and doesn’t want her to just throw that away
kulith knows what it’s like to be alone, but esela’s always had people around her
esela can have the power and authority that kulith never had and lived under all her life, why shouldn’t esela take what she can get?
kulith talks about this with esela and finally expresses her feelings a bit more


they agree that they’ll leave, but maybe one day they’ll come back

spoiler alert they dont get to come back because it gets fucking decimated by a meteor :( oops :(
